name: Skyy’s Lounge / Cozy
description:
The space
Skyy’s Lounge ....Everything warm, from linen to dresser and lounge chair. Splashed with a touch of navy blue you will find peace & tranquility in the soothing tapestry of Skyy's flair. The picture speaks for itself; it is sheer elegance. Further indulge yourself in 288 square feet of spacious comfort; made complete with a 40" flat screen TV, DVD player, cable and internet access. There is no need to leave this room unless you choose to take a leisurely stroll to Dunkin' Donuts. We are walking distance to Journal Square Train & Bus Depot-the access point to NYC and other hot spots throughout the state of NJ. The Holland Tunnel is a 3 minute ride from the house; making downtown NYC conveniently one mile away. Newark Airport is approximately a 15 minute drive. Taxi service to and from your destination is literally a whistle away. Great night life and fabulous restaurants adorn the downtown Jersey City and Hoboken area. I love to work out at the gym, pamper my dog and spend time with my child Logan ! The Milk room is infant ready , we supply a baby crib up to age three /60lbs.

name: Minutes to Manhattan & Jersey Shore
description:
Walking to distance to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island with New York City Skyline.

The space
Located in the up and coming Lafayette neighborhood, you are invited to enjoy the first floor of a hundred plus year old brownstone that has been completely renovated and wraps you in old world charm.

This is NOT a shared space. You will have complete privacy in your own private apartment.
The rooms are large, spacious, and airy. The kitchen is modern and is fully supplied with dishes and cookware, with a gas range, stainless steel refrigerator, granite counter top, and large dinning table. The bathroom is tastefully designed; complete with full sized bathtub and quality shower heads. Fresh linens and towels are included. Rest peacefully on a queen sized foam mattress bed. There is one very large closet and a one smaller one that is sure to accommodate your storage needs.

In the evenings, you can relax on a patio and enjoy a cigar,
neighborhood_overview: Such close proximity to NYC, 7 minutes on the Path  Train to World Trade Center, 25 Mins to Empire State Building in NYC.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: Hello and thank you for taking the time to read about me.  My family and I have been living in New Jersey, Jersey City for over a decade now and we cannot think of a better place to be.  I too love to travel and have been all over Europe, Asia and Africa.  My favorite place that I have visited is Tahiti…it just felt like heaven to me.  I am a city girl and just love the idea that I live so close to Manhattan and I can be at the theatre in less than 20 minutes.

name: Room & Private Bath~Minutes to NYC!
description:
Enjoy your stay in the tri-state area at my townhouse! Two blocks walk to the PATH train, 7 minutes to World Trade Center, 12 minutes to the West Village.

This is a first floor room with a queen size bed, private bathroom, and access to the backyard. Lots of privacy as I live on the 2nd and 3rd floor.

Enjoy wifi, cable tv, microwave, mini fridge, electric water boiler, utensils, utility sink for washing dishes, and washer / dryer.

The space
The room I'm renting is conveniently located on the first floor of my townhouse. No stairs! It has a queen size bed, closet, cable tv, wifi, and ceiling fan. Right next to the room is your own private bathroom. There is also a door to the back yard so you can enjoy some outdoor space.

2 adults, or 2 adults with 1 small child can comfortably fit in the room.

My roommate and I have bedrooms and a bathroom on the third floor, so you will have plenty of privacy. You would only see us
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is quite safe, and has great restaurants, bars, and shops all within walking distance. There are parks nearby as well. If you walk 10 minutes to the waterfront you will get spectacular views of Manhattan. A large shopping mall and grocery store are also a couple blocks away. I have lived here over 10 years and feel very safe.

Other local attractions include Hoboken, the birthplace of Frank Sinatra and the Cake Boss, Liberty Science Center, and Liberty State Park. Liberty State Park has ferry service to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and Manhattan, not to mention great views. And of course, you are very close to Manhattan.

Spacious and unique loft apartment on the ground floor of a 3 story house in Jersey City. Completely private no shares.

The loft space is located in Jersey City's Journal Square neighborhood, and just a 7 minute walk to Journal Square Path train station. Downtown Manhattan is 3 stops from the station - about a 12 minute ride.

The loft is one open space with original details, well stocked kitchen, full bathroom, one full size loft bed, a full bed and a sofa. Max number of peoples I prefer to host is 4.

The kitchen is new and fully equipped with dishes and cookware, 2 burner in
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is seconds from "Little India", which offers low-budget to formal Indian dining, in addition to Filipino, Latin American, and Egyptian cuisine, reflecting the city's wide ethnic population. Downtown Jersey City is also minutes away and offers a big variety of Bars and Restaurants.

Jersey City is just across the Hudson river, and it's closer and better connected to the heart of Manhattan than some boroughs and locations in New York City. It is literally 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan by subway (path train) and 15mn away from Greenwich Village and midtown. The Path Train runs all day and all night on a schedule.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
I am an artist working with movement and stuff. Originally from Italy. 
I travel often with art projects and use airbnb and I equally allow other people to use my apartments in the NYC area. My places are simple nothing luxurious but with good energy if you are into that, and I try to keep the price affordable. I am co founder and co-director of a non profit dance organization called Shua Group and co founder of  an artist run  space in Jersey City called Shuaspace, an incubator for ideas an community actions. Thank you for supporting all this as it is harder and harder for artists to keep their work going in the expensive New York City area. 
Thank you!

name: Lovely Apartment - close to NYC
description:
Our guests tell us that they love coming back to the apartment - that it feels like home. We want our guests to know that even though you can see the Empire State Building from the apartment, it still takes about 45 minutes to get into Manhattan.

The space
Lovely newly renovated, 4 room apartment with separate entrance in private Victorian home in Jersey City Heights - close to New York City.

Quiet tree lined street with view of Empire State Building and a green backyard in the spring and summer. Two bedrooms - one with full size bed for a couple, and the other with a single bed. Sheets and towels are of course provided. The living room also has a futon which can accommodate another two people. (The price for additional guests is $10. per person for children and $20. for adults) Great kitchen with all new appliances and everything you need to cook. Very spacious and clean bathroom with hair dryer, shampoo and conditioner and some other basic toiletr
neighborhood_overview: Our area of Jersey City Heights is quiet and safe and yet just a short bus or train ride to the middle of Manhattan. Guests tell us they enjoy coming back to the quiet of our apartment after a busy day in NYC.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: My husband Harry and I work(ed) in the creative arts.  I recently retired. We have lived in this area all of our lives except for two years in London. We have traveled abroad and look forward to meeting people from across the globe.  We are happy to share our insights about where to go in the NYC area.  We have two children who are no longer living at home so we decided to convert our top floor into this lovely vacation rental.  It is a completely separate apartment from our own.  We look forward to having visitors stay in this apartment. We speak some Spanish.

name: New apt in downtown JC minutes away from Manhattan
description:
Recently renovated one-bedroom apartment in the heart of downtown Jersey City. Located very conveniently to commute or travel to Manhattan and to arrive, door to door, in less than 30 minutes to most of the relevant places in NY, such as Wall Street, Greenwich Village, or Penn Station in Midtown.


Enjoy this one bedroom apartment, that accommodates 4 people, and its completely new furniture. It also includes wifi, TV with Netflix, and a large kitchen with all appliances including dishwasher.

The space
BEDROOM: The apartment includes a separate bedroom with a QUEEN-SIZE bed and a large closet. We provide sets of linens and towels for your use. The bedroom also included a desk and a chair.

LIVING: There is an open living room area with a QUEEN-SIZE convertible sofa (perfect for two people to sleep).

DINING: that perfectly fits a group of 4 people, where you can enjoy your meals together.

KITCHEN with supplies s
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJ’S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.

name: Nice Apt -10 minutes to Manhattan
description:
Large apartment in Downtown Jersey City, steps from the Grove street Path station, less than 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan (World Trade Center.)

STR-00093

The space
Situated on the ground floor of a 19th century townhouse, this open-space apartment is spacious, quiet and fun. It features hardwood floors, a small kitchen with direct access to the garden. There is a queen-sized bed as well as a comfortable futon, so four persons can easily stay in the apartment. There's also a nice-sized closet space and an empty chest of drawers.

The living room has a seating area with DirectTV and free Wifi. The kitchen has a gas range, a fridge, a microwave as well as basic utensils and a washing machine for the laundry. The bathroom has a bathtub/shower.

The apartment is located in Historic Downtown Jersey City, just across the Hudson river from Manhattan (only 2 blocks from the Grove street PATH subway which offer direct and 24/7 acc
neighborhood_overview:
Mercer Street is in the heart of Historic Downtown/Van Vorst areas of Jersey City anchored by the Grove Street PATH station. When not exploring Manhattan, there is much to do in Jersey City. These include:
* walking along the Hudson River Waterfront for great views of Manhattan or venturing over to Hoboken for the great bar scene
* checking out the great restaurants in the area
* visiting massive Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty
* taking the kids to the Liberty Science Center
* attending the Farmers' Market or the live music performances at Grove Square: http://www.jcdowntown.org/
* shopping at the Newport Center Mall or the local boutiques scattered on Grove Street or finding a bargain at the flea market on Saturday's at Van Vorst Park

Beautiful, newly renovated and spacious 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom condo with desirable top floor deck located just minutes from NYC and Hoboken in Jersey City Heights.

As if it wasn't enough, all transport connections to NYC are only a few feet away.

The space

neighborhood_overview: The property is conveniently located about 25 minutes from Newark Liberty International Airport. Public transportation is also easily accessible – shuttle service to PATH/Ferry & just a short walk to the NY Waterway Ferry, Hudson-Bergen light rail, and the PATH.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: DWTN Jersey City Art Studio Apt, long term stays
description:
Art studio apt. in downtown Jersey City. Completely renovated with custom Murphy bed, radiant floor heating and A/C, gas cooktop, bathroom w/walk-in shower, and private street entrance. It is a 12-min. walk to PATH station; then two stops to World Trade Center (NYC) or 6 stops to mid-town NYC.

The space
This ground floor, studio apartment is in downtown Jersey City, where I live part of the year. You have one full-time neighbor upstairs. The building was originally built in 1885 but fully renovated in 2015. The apartment is a studio and has a water heater and water pump in the unit that run occasionally. You will occasionally hear the appliances as well as the upstairs guest footfall ... Ear plugs for sleeping are the simple solution if complete silence is needed.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire studio apartment and small backyard.

Other things to note
Parking is limited in Jersey City so I don't re
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is exploding with new restaurants, high rises, and notoriety ... it is the new hot spot to live in the NYC metro area. You will find one of the best restaurants (Madame Claude's) one block from my place, but there are lots of great bars and restaurants nearby.

RESTAURANTS/BARS:
Madame Claude's - amazing French food, killer brunch, fantastic Parisian music Thursday nights ... get a reservation. (1 min. walk)
Porta - great pizza (10 min.)
Talde - pricey, but memorable (10 min.)
Mathews - haven't been, but heard it's great. (12 min.)
White Star - local dive bar w/solid food (3 min.)
Third and Vine - wine and cheese bar (3 min.)
Ibby's Falafel - great falafel sandwich (14 min.)
Pet Shop - used to be local pet shop, now it's a bar (8 min.)
Dullboy - cocktail lounge w/NYC vibe (12 min.)
BeClaws - if you want seafood (7 min.)
Taqueria - great fish, pork tacos (13 min.)
White Horse - fine dining,

name: Dr Norton House@Lincoln Park JC,NJ
description:
Private, large apt in Victorian House in Historic Lincoln Park section of Jersey City. 1 mile to JSQ PATH train to NYC/Hoboken. Bus on corner to NYC! Hardwd flrs, 12 foot ceilings, new kitchen, 1.5 baths, 2 BR + pull out sofa, TV, WiFi, laundry.

The space
1st flr apt of beautiful Victorian House in Historic Lincoln Park section of Jersey City. We just installed brand new central A/C and heat system! Stunning hardwood floors have just been redone, 12 foot ceilings, new kitchen, 1.5 baths, 2 BR (1 queen, 1 full) + pull out sofa, TV, WiFi, laundry. 1 mi from JSQ PATH train to NYC/Hoboken. Bus on corner to NYC!

This is a beautiful, comfortable space with all the amenities you may need. You can walk 50 yards to catch the #10 bus that brings you 1 mile to Journal Square where you can catch the PATH train to NYC, Hoboken or Newark, which connects you to NJ Transit trains to everywhere! You can also catch the #119 bus right on the corner to Port Authority i
neighborhood_overview:
It is one mile from the Journal Square transportation center (JSQ on the PATH line). From JSQ, you can take the PATH to Newark and catch the NJ Transit trains. You can also go to Hoboken, World Trade Center or take the 33rd Street line to Greenwich Village or uptown. It takes less than one hour to get to 33rd St via PATH. There is a bus stop right on the corner about 100 feet away. From there, you can get the bus to JSQ or directly into Port Authority in NYC, which puts you right near Times Square and the theater district. The bus to Port Authority usually takes 45-60 minutes. We are one block from Lincoln Park, which offers great walks and opportunities to work out, including jogging paths and a track.
We are 5 blocks from St. Peter's University, 1.5 miles to NJCU and a mile from Hudson County Community College.
We are also very close to Liberty State Park, which is one of the most visited state parks in the country! You can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Is
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: I am a lifelong resident of Jersey City, NJ. I work in Hoboken, NJ. I also have spent much of my life at the Jersey Shore. I travel a fair amount and spend a lot of time in New England, specifically Maine and Martha's Vineyard. I am a hairdresser and musician. Piano is my main instrument. I am also a licensed social worker in NJ!  If you are coming to the NJ/NY area, I hope you consider staying here at the beautiful apartment in the Dr. Norton House! I can help you find all sorts of great things to do and places to eat and visit. Contact me for any further questions or info!

name: Historic Brownstone in Jersey City
description:
Private floor in a Victorian brownstone with 2 berms, bath and a kitchenette. Easy street parking or parking 1 block offsite at $10/day. In historic neighborhood; quick assess to Manhattan, NJ turnpike, EWR, Path train, MetLife Stadium.

The space
The accommodation consists of a very large and spacious double bedroom with a private bathroom and kitchenette for your sole use on the second floor of our newly restored brownstone in the historic West Side district of Jersey City.

The room has a queen size bed in an alcove, with a living area for working or relaxing. There is also a second bedroom on the same floor that is available for larger groups or families. Both rooms have original marble mantles with wood floors. The two rooms are joined together by a small, but fully equipped, kitchenette with gas hob, microwave and fridge. We never have more than one booking at any one time, so it will always be just your travelling party staying with us.

name: NYC & Hudson River views (2 BR)
description:
Spacious (1550 sq. ft / 144 sq. meters) apartment in a luxury condo building along the Hudson River with amazing NYC views. Enjoy the outdoor pool, gym and various other amenities including parking. One block from Ferry, Path (5 mins to NYC) & light rail.

name: Cute private apt + extras Jersey City (NYC area)
description:
Enjoy a beautiful, private apartment blocks from Liberty State Park in Jersey City, close to ferry to NYC Manhattan and light rail. Full kitchen w/ dishwasher, tub/shower, desk for working from home, private outdoor area. Queen-size bedroom & couch in living room. Whether you come to see New York on a budget in comfort, or stay to get the feel of Jersey City living, this is a wonderful, welcoming place.

The space
This apartment is wonderfully furnished and stocked with all the essentials. Everything you need for a great stay is here...full kitchen, dishwasher, Queen-size bed, comfortable couch, desk & desk chair, board games, fresh linens, maps, etc. We also have a pack and play if you are traveling with a little one. Private, clean and well-stocked. We do have a tv with HDMI input cord but we do NOT have cable, so if you are going on vacation to watch a lot of tv this probably isn't the right apt for you.

Guest access
Check in time is 3pm
neighborhood_overview: We are just blocks away from Liberty State Park where you can get a great view of the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan skyline. Our neighborhood (Lafayette) was home to Lenape and then one of the oldest Dutch settlements in the area. We are now an urban area close to light rail and ferry. The PATH train is a 20 minute walk or take the light rail to connect.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: We are a family who loves living in Jersey City. We are involved in community groups working to make this a wonderful place to live, work and play.  We live on a quiet, family-friendly street and enjoy using Liberty State Park and all of the other amenities our area offers. We also love to travel, and our favorite places to visit so far are the west coast of Ireland, Prague, San Francisco and the Yucatan peninsula. We like to be active when traveling- to learn the history of a place. When hosting we love for our guests to learn the same. We will give you as much or as little advice/direction as you want and most of all we want you to enjoy this place as much as we do.

host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
I spent 20 years on Wall Street as a Risk Manager.  I live here with my family (wife and 7 year old son and 8 year old daughter).  This row house was built in 1843.  I am a CPA and I have an MBA in finance.  I attended NYU and Fordham University.  My family and I live in the top three floors and are making available the garden level.  The garden level is a separate apartment and this building is a legal two family.  The garden level was recently restored and most everything in it is new except for a few items.  The yard is quiet and the apartment has a private entrance from both the street and yard.  

My wife and I typically travel to the Caribbean islands and prefer quiet locations such as Anguilla, St John's, Tortola, Barbuda, the Grenadine Islands or the Outer Islands of the Bahamas.  Because of our children we have not traveled to Europe or other far places in recent years.  We also travel to Maine, Vermont and Cape Code during the summer months.

name: Cozy Loft Space In Funky Jersey City Record Store!
description:
A cozy studio apartment in the back of an actual functioning record store. Located in a beautiful 1920s pharmacy, it's just an 8 minute walk to the subway, then 10 min into NYC. Simple, functional kitchen & bathroom (separate from sleeping area), cable TV, internet, tempurpedic bed, COMFY AND CHARMING!

The space
Your Jersey City home will be a studio apartment of a 1920s antique pharmacy storefront, complete with beautiful dark wood, phone booths and sliding wooden ladders. This store was the actual pharmacy for the Italian/Irish immigrants in the neighborhood, hence the medicine bottles and other antiques in the showcases. To get to the living space, you walk through the front door of the store to the back staircase and then left up to the living space. The upstairs apartment hovers above the store and your bedroom looks down onto the record store itself (see photo). The kitchen table upstairs looks out onto a courtyard and the bathroom adjoins the eating area.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the old "Italian Village" section of Jersey City, now simply known as "The Village." There's Madame Claude's bistro two blocks away (French) and a bunch of great restaurants on the way to the PATH train on Newark Avenue. Safe and quiet, our neighborhood is lovely. Rent from us and we will include our "Email Guide To Jersey City & NYC," which includes our special, inside look at the area, including restaurant recommendations and the best way to approach New York City. This guide will be on the kitchen table when you arrive.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: A self-styled entrepreneur, fluent in the world of baseball and music. I call the New York area home, but am equally comfortable in Quebec City or Europe. I love sharing my apartments with people from all over the world and learning from each experience. It's important to stop and enjoy life, to read books, to hang out with friends. Money matters, but money is not everything. It seems to me that massive perspective can make someone very wise, that we are not on this earth for a long time, that we should plant trees that we will not sit under. My apartments are filled with books, music and film that echo these notions. So enjoy! And I look forward to meeting you.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Modern 3 Bdr with great Reviews
description:
My renovated apt in a 1922 building is quiet clean, and family freindly. This oasis is a very convenient bus ride to Times Square, NYC and walking to Hoboken. Also a block away from Washington Park and the famous Coach House Diner.

The space
This oasis is on the border of Jersey City Heights, North Bergen, Hoboken, Secaucus and Jersey City. At first glance the neighborhood isn't pretty but very safe and convenient so when you are back home you will feel relaxed and taken care of. The neighborhood is mostly Latin and has the flavor of Cuba, Equador and the Dominican Republic.
My 3 bedroom apartment is spacious and designed so that it flows easily for 4-5 people. Family and business travelers friendly. Although it has one bathroom it's like a spa tucked away yet the shower's window opens and can feel like an outdoor shower experience.

You will have access to the whole apartment which includes washer dryer, full kitchen, Sonos wireless stereo, free
neighborhood_overview: This oasis is on the border of Jersey City Heights, North Bergen, Hoboken, Secaucus and Jersey City. At first glance the neighborhood isn't pretty but very safe and convenient so when you are back home you will feel relaxed and taken care of. The neighborhood is mostly Latin and has the flavor of Cuba, Equador and the Dominican Republic. I love the Cuban and Latin restaurants within walking of the apartment. Of course I also love the famous Coach House Diner which is open 24 hours. You don't really need a car here because everything is so convenient including easy and inexpensive access to Manhattan.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: Hi - I am an easy going entrepreneur who has traveled a lot in my previous years. I lived in Japan and have moved around with my family when I was young.  I am always curious and like to learn.  I like my home to be neat and not cluttered.  When I rent in other destinations I look for neatness and no clutter too! You will feel comfortable in my home.

description:
As title implies Piccoline means small, . separate entrance, entire apartment. WI-FI, cable TV. 10 min walking to 24/7 supermarket, bus stop just minutes away from home. 15 to 24 minutes by bus to journal square path train station (subway). total time to NYC about 1hour. Street parking is limited and can be difficult to find a space,
absolutely no overnight guests!!!

The space
separate entrance , this studio has own bathroom, shower and toilet in utility room, kitchenette sink / vanity sink. kitchen, not suitable for heavy cooking. electric skillet, rice cooker, microwave, coffee maker, toaster oven, tea kettle, kitchen utensil's, no gas stove, full size fridge, cable TV wifi included, full size bed, with fresh linens and towels.

traffic.

name: Classic 1 Bedroom Apartment in Jersey City Newport
description:
Standing 50 stories high and overlooking Manhattan's skyline, this luxury building is a one of a kind; offering the latest in amenities and services like an outdoor heated pool and spa, a fitness center, a theatre room, a playroom, and a sophisticated clubroom, you will find well-appointed apartments with nine foot ceilings, fully-equipped designer kitchens, and hardwood floors. As if it wasn't enough, all transport connections to NYC are only a few feet away.

The space
Experience luxury like you never have before in these fantastic Hudson riverfront apartments. Do you fancy a heated outdoor pool and spa with Manhattan views? A modern fitness center, a state-of-the-art theatre room, a clubroom with billiards, and a playroom and playground for the kids? You got it in this tower located a few steps away from the Newport Path station and the best restaurants in the area offering fantastic skyline views. These apartments feature the best upscale finishes like 9 foot
neighborhood_overview: The property is conveniently located about 25 minutes from Newark Liberty International Airport. Public transportation is also easily accessible – shuttle service to PATH/Ferry & just a short walk to the NY Waterway Ferry, Hudson-Bergen light rail, and the PATH.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Studio at heart of Downtown JC.
description:
Studio at a recently renovated building. Approx 230 sqft (23m2) (small but you will have the convenience of total privacy and a whole studio for yourself). Long built-in closets with sliding doors South orientation & two large windows. Fridge available (No kitchen, stove or oven available). High-speed Internet. 5-Minutes walk to Path at Grove Station. 20 min to Manhattan. 5-minute walk to facilities like supermarkets, laundries. No Pets. Storage available off-unit.

The space
LIVING & BEDROOM: The apartment includes a QUEEN-SIZE bed and a large closet. We provide sets of linens and towels for your use. The bedroom also included a table and two chairs to fit, comfortably a group of 2 people.

KITCHEN: There is no kitchen where you can cook in the studio but there is a sink in case you want to order or prepare something simple at the counter. there is a small fridge.

BATHROOM: enjoy the rain shower in the bathroom.

STORAGE: For the
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJ’S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.

Enjoy this studio, that accommodates 2 people. It also includes wifi and TV.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Spanish architect with offices in Madrid, Chennai and New York. Passionate about traveling and understanding other ways of living and thinking. I had the fortune to live and work on five continents. I use Airbnb to both host and travel as a guest.

name: Historic Downtown Jersey City
description:
Less than 15 minutes from Manhattan by PATH- Vibrant downtown Jersey City offers diverse restaurants, authentic French and Italian bakeries, quaint parks, farmer's markets and a night time Hudson River view of the sparkling New York City skyline.

The space
We appreciate it’s a scary time to travel. We have your clean and germ free landing place taken care of - and a goldfish to keep you company! Bright and quiet one bedroom apartment located in Historic Downtown. Five blocks from the Grove Street PATH Station.
One queen sized bed, and a full sized futon in the living room. Perfect for a couple or a family of four. The apartment is not ideal for four adults but works well for families of 4 or less when 2 are children.
We also have pack-n-play for small children or babies.
And plenty of closet space in the entry hall.
Washer and dryer and a grocery store a block away.

Guest access
Guests have access to their own washer
neighborhood_overview: Ideal location for a New York visit.  Plenty of hip spots here in Jersey City - but let's face it - New York is right next door!
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Jennifer and Roland fell in love in Washington DC, and now live in their dream home in downtown Jersey City.  Jennifer works in Midtown Manhattan and Roland works in his home-office.  They have three teenagers - real New Yorkers, smart, sassy and worldly.  And they travel often to see their family in California, Israel, France and Germany.  Come and stay with us!

name: Modern, Luxury High-rise w/STUNNING SKYLINE VIEWS
description:
Close to New York City hot spots and only a quick ferry ride / one subway stop from the World Trade Center and the popular Westfield World Shopping Center. This beautiful apartment is on the 41st floor of a luxury high rise building with breathtaking skyline views.

The building offers: guest access to the gym, yoga studio, business office space, (seasonal) pool & Jacuzzi and is seconds from a gourmet grocer, tasty local restaurants and bars. 5 Minutes to Downtown NYC via Path train or Ferry.

The space
Modern, luxurious, studio space with stunning views of the Hudson River Waterfront and Downtown Jersey city. Apartment includes:
-Washer/Dryer
-Dinning and lounging space
-Alcove a queen size bed for rest and restoration.
-Building gym, yoga studio,
- (seasonal) Pool and Jacuzzi

Guest access
Enjoy full access to the entire apartment as well as building access to the gym, yoga studio, recreation and theatr
neighborhood_overview: The Paulus Hook neighborhood is a charming, tree-lined area, seconds from the Waterfront and 5 minutes from Downtown Jersey City. Restaurants, bars and eclectic shops/boutiques are within steps from the apartment.

neighborhood_overview:
Modern residences across the 300-acre community, which is home to 15,000 people, feature spacious, light-filled apartments with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. Residences feature open layouts with hardwood floors, oversized windows, 24-hour doorman services, parking and laundry facilities. Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and children’s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the community’s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.

name: (A) At the foot of the Statute
description:
PROS
Conveniently located to access lower Manhattan and visit the Statute of Liberty
Suitable for people using Newark Airport, driving car, traveling in group or looking for basic accommodation

CONS
There is a construction of a tall apartment complex in a lot adjacent to our property and you may feel like staying in the middle of a construction site.
Not located in downtown Jersey City and very limited availability of stores/restaurants in the neighborhood.

The space
- Independent 2 bedroom house (780 sf)
- There are 2 houses on the premise -- one single-family and one two-family (+ basement) separated by deck
- The owner lives in one of the units
- The property is recently renovated and we are still working on a limited amount of fixing such as painting deck and putting fence in the front and surroundings (as of Oct)

Guest access
- WIFI Internet Connection (password on the fridge)
- Refr
neighborhood_overview:
- Not a greatest neighborhood in Jersey City. We are one Light Rail stop off from the most developed/expensive part of JC (and the contrast is quite clear). You will notice graffiti as well as bars covering the windows (but the crime rate is not at all high compared to surrounding area including downtown JC based on public statistics). Some of our guests were not comfortable being in the neighborhood and it took for our family to get used to it.
- The neighborhood could be noisy due to freight railway that passes nearby and a neighbor who plays loud music outside every few Saturday.
- Limited supermarkets and restaurants availability (a few small convenient stores in the neighborhood but, for a decent supermaket, you will have to take light rail to Hudson Greene Market near Exchange Place station.)

name: A Spacious, Private Apartment in a Brick Row House
description:
Manhattan is only 20- 30 minutes away by bus/subway. Buses going to Times Square/Port Authority are 3 minutes from the house. The Journal Square Path (subway) station is about 15 minutes walking or a quick shuttle bus ride.

Relax and unwind in our comfortable, eclectic six room space after a day of sightseeing. This large apartment occupies the entire 1st floor of a 1910s era home in Jersey City's 'The Heights' neighborhood. The residential area is quiet and safe.

STR21-00050 9/19/2021

The space
★APARTMENT: Guests have exclusive use of the 1000+ square foot apartment. Although we live in the same house as the Airbnb, we work to ensure guest privacy.

★PARKING/TRANSPORTATION: Please refer to the 'getting around' section for full for details on all parking rules. A visitor parking permit is required Monday-Friday at a cost of $5 per day for guests who are driving.

★CLEANING: In addition to standard cleaning
neighborhood_overview:
"The Heights" is a diverse neighborhood in Jersey City. Local grocery, limited restaurant/deli and liquor stores are within a 5-20 minute walk. There are also two urban parks within walking distance, Pershing Field and Gordon Park. Pershing field has playground equipment, tennis courts and other amenities.

Please note "the Heights" is not in the 'downtown' area of Jersey City that borders the Hudson River. The Heights is primarily a residential, rather than commercial, neighborhood. You can reach Jersey City's waterfront via 2 subway stops, Grove Street or Exchange Place or take a taxi there.

It's in a 1905 brownstone that has been taken care of beautifully, within a 3 minute walk to the JC PATH & a 12 minute train ride to NYC. I fell in love with this place and you will too!

The space
Hello! Justin here and I have lived in the NY Metro area for 6 years and in this apartment for 2!

3E5 is my personal labour of love and I enjoy sharing my work with family, friends and guests. I work in the city in the heart of the Meatpacking District in NYC in the hospitality world for a boutique hotel and spend my down time building furniture, singing/recording in the studio and cooking in the kitchen or entertaining (a love passed down to me from my parents).

At work and in real life I enjoy playing host and doing my best to enhance other people's journeys and I'd love to do that for you too.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is the new emerging city in the NY Metro area, the new, old Williamsburg.

A short walk or even shorter train ride to downtown Jersey City will introduce you to a trove of restaurants, ice cream shops, bars & farmers markets.

The best view of New York is from Jersey City and it is a breathtaking one!

I work from home - but have 2 bedrooms and 1 bath to spare: 1 huge bedroom - with queen size bed and smaller bedroom with full size bed. neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is one of the most diverse cities in the country and residents celebrate and enjoy our multi-culturalism.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
I have an eclectic background - and enjoy eclectic people. I work in the non-profit sector - but have also worked in consumer publishing and as a VISTA volunteer. I am committed to driving educational equity and access in the US and internationally - and am the co-founder and board president of 2 non-profits supporting educational opportunities (charter school in Jersey City, non profit in Nicaragua supporting 11 schools.). I love music and dancing (jazz, latin jazz. timba, salsa, rumba) and would happy to take you along - or recommend some of the best NYC hot spots that tourists might not know about. I am an internationally certified Pilates instructor and also practice yoga.  I often host international students here studying English and am fluent in Spanish. 
I love to travel, love people - and want to be sure you have the best trip ever...

name: Historic District - New Renovation
description:
Lovely one bedroom apartment, just renovated, on tree-lined street in historic district of Jersey City. Easy access to NYC. This flat is quiet, sunny, and has a private entrance. Has luxurious bathroom and fully equipped kitchen.

The space
The apartment is attached to a victorian house in the historic 'Doctors Row' section of Jersey City. It is a half block from Lincoln Park, and two blocks from a Citi Bikes station. It has a private entrance on the side of the house, and sits back from the street. Although attached to the house, it is a separate unit and was originally built as a doctor's office as was typical in the neighborhood at the time. A total gut renovation was done in 2016 and the apartment is being maintained in impeccable condition.

Other things to note
There is a washer/dryer in the unit.
neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful Lincoln Park is only a half block away and is part of the newly designated historic district. The park boasts river-front views, a 9-hole golf course, tennis courts, bird sanctuary, and a grand fountain recently restored to its original glory (designed by Pierre J. Cheron, it is the world's largest concrete monument!).
There are many great restaurants in Jersey City, along with farmers' markets and easy access to grocery and other shopping. Restaurant recommendations will be provided on your arrival, along with local transportation info and other helpful tips.

name: Cozy red studio 15 min walk to JSQ path station
description:
15 min walk to Journal Sq Path. Then it's 15 min to WTC, 25 min to 34th St. Use Citibike or Uber to Path. Uber pool is $3-4 per person to Journal Sq Path.
Located in a historic brownstone building, the studio has a high ceiling, hardwood floors. Living area has a futon; sleeping area has a bed. The neighborhood is safe but not fancy. You can see garbage on the street like NYC. I can't change my location and the cleanliness of the neighborhood. But my cleanliness is five star. So is my value.

The space
A cozy, quiet and spacious nest that you could hide in after a long day in busy Manhattan. Comfortable space, all in one, under a high ceiling. Lots of light if wanted. Antique shutters, faux fireplace. Fridge, small kitchen, microwave oven, gas range stove, dining area, bathroom with a corner shower unit, living quarter with a futon and a big TV. Sleeping quarter is divided from the rest by a bookcase. Kitchen has pots and pans, plates, cups, a coffee make
neighborhood_overview:
This is a cosmopolitan neighborhood. The Journal Square Path Station (Jersey City-Hoboken's subway system that connects us to Manhattan) is only 15 min walking distance away. We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This studio is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city. If you are from the suburbs or small cities of the US with no traffic, no crowds, be prepared for big city life. It’s a safe neighborhood. My family and I have lived in this neighborhood for almost two decades. None of my tenants, guests or neighbors have had an issue about safety.
If you want a good value for your money, this is the right place for you!
STREET PARKING: If you are planning to come with a car, you're lucky if you can find a spot on the street. Jersey City is a highly populated city

name: Spacious 1BR |  Work from Home| Jersey City by GLS
description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
-Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
-Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
-Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
At Global Luxury Suites, your well being is our top priority, therefore, we are following the CDC guidelines to ensure your safety. All apartments are thoroughly cleaned after each resident has checked out and before another guest checks in. All linens are changed and surfaces are sanitized (handles, windows, appliances, countertops, furniture, etc.). In addition, our teams will be fully sanitizing common areas such as business centers and recreation rooms for guests’ safety.
neighborhood_overview:
Heading into NYC or exploring the NY metro area? This high-rise is conveniently located down the street from the NY Waterway Ferry, the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail, and the PATH train. Getting into the Big Apple has never been easier!

•Restaurants – Amiya (.4 mi), Bertucci’s Brick Oven Restaurant (.3 mi), VB3 (213 ft.), Fire & Oak (220 ft.)

name: Private Jersey City 2 Bedroom Apartment near PATH
description:
Standing 50 stories high and overlooking Manhattan's skyline, this luxury building is a one of a kind; offering the latest in amenities and services like an outdoor heated pool and spa, a fitness center, a theatre room, a playroom, and a sophisticated clubroom, you will find well-appointed apartments with nine foot ceilings, fully-equipped designer kitchens, and hardwood floors. As if it wasn't enough, all transport connections to NYC are only a few feet away.

The space
Experience luxury like you never have before in these fantastic Hudson riverfront apartments. Do you fancy a heated outdoor pool and spa with Manhattan views? A modern fitness center, a state-of-the-art theatre room, a clubroom with billiards, and a playroom and playground for the kids? You got it in this tower located a few steps away from the Newport Path station and the best restaurants in the area offering fantastic skyline views. These apartments feature the best upscale finishes like 9 foot
neighborhood_overview: This apartment building is located directly across the Hudson River from New York City, within a large commerce hub in Jersey City, New Jersey. This location is known as one of the most diverse cities on the East Coast and a perfect destination; not only for business but also leisure travelers. Jersey City is a hub of industry with its oil refineries, warehouses, and plants. Although known for its industrial prowess, Jersey City’s gem is Liberty State Park, which offers impeccable views of Manhattan, the Statue of Liberty, and Ellis Island.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Freedom BSMT Room
description:
10 minutes drive to Newark International Airport. 20 minutes to WTC, and 45 minutes to Midtown Manhattan. 3 minutes walk distance to light rail station.
This is a private basement room.
Please note: Light rail and Path Train are NJ transit, separate with NYC Subway.

The space
Private basement room. Private bathrooms and shared kitchen. Private refrigerator.

Other things to note
The house is located in Jersey City. The commute system is separated with NYC MTA.
Please understand this is a BUDGET accommodation , and price are extremely competitively for the NYC area. Please have reasonable expectations about what your're getting for the money that you are paying. Recognize that things in the NYC area are more expensive than many parts of the world.
I provide a weekly professional cleaning of the common spaces, and additional cleaning if issues arise. I try as I might, sometimes someone may leave a dirty dish in the sink,

description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
-Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
-Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
-Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
At Global Luxury Suites, your well being is our top priority, therefore, we are following the CDC guidelines to ensure your safety. All apartments are thoroughly cleaned after each resident has checked out and before another guest checks in. All linens are changed and surfaces are sanitized (handles, windows, appliances, countertops, furniture, etc.). In addition, our teams will be fully sanitizing common areas such as business centers and recreation rooms for guests’ safety.

name: 1 Bedroom near to Grove street PATH
description:
This is a large one bedroom right by Grove Street Path Station. These downtown Jersey City apartments are a 10-minute train ride to New York City. It features a fitness center and tennis courts. Modern guest rooms offer free Wi-Fi and fully equipped kitchens.
A flat-screen TV and in-unit laundry facilities are equipped in each apartment at Columbus Suites. The spacious apartments feature dark wood furniture and include a seating area with a work desk.

Gym/Pool accessible for a month stay.

name: Warm & Welcoming room 3 blocks to PATH train $42
description:
One block around the corner from Van Vorst park, several blocks from Liberty State Park & the Statue of Liberty, 8 blocks from the Hudson River and a great view of NYC.

This cozy private room is on the 3rd floor of a large brownstone. Twin-sized bed. Small desk, cute yellow stool, bookcase, small victorian chest. Large closet.

Shared bath & kitchen.

A 3-block walk to the PATH.

The space
This is a large brownstone row house. The bedroom is located on the third floor and the shared bathroom is located on the second floor.

The entire house has a wonderful vibe with an eclectic array of furnishing.

Guest access
While the room private, the Bath and Kitchen are SHARED, there is a Washer/Dryer area.

Both the bathroom and kitchen are located on the floor below the room.

House cat on the premises

Other things to note
This is a quiet space. No parties. No no
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is a vibrant and diverse community of neighborhoods. Lots of restaurants and drinking establishments and food shops. Citi Bike stands are only a few blocks away in any direction from the house.

With the PATH train only a few blocks away, access into NYC is on a 24/7 basis. Both uptown to 33rd St and downtown to WTC.

On-street parking: No Parking for non-residents from 8:30am to 5pm daily. OK for weekends. Even with a parking permit, parking is very limited. There is alternative street cleaning.

name: Spacious Apt 10 Min from Manhattan
description:
Great 2 bedroom apartment in a townhouse in Historic Downtown Jersey City, just across the Hudson river from Manhattan (only 2 blocks from the Grove street PATH subway which offer direct and 24/7 access to Manhattan.)

The space
The apartment is located in Historic Downtown Jersey City, just across the Hudson river from Manhattan (only 2 blocks from the Grove street PATH subway which offer direct and 24/7 access to Manhattan.)
The neighborhood is safe and diverse with many charming restaurants and cafes as well as several delis convenient for grocery shopping.
Situated on the second floor of a 19th century townhouse, this two bedroom apartment is quiet, bright and cheerful. It features hardwood floors, large kitchen and a small sunny deck.
The main bedroom is large and bright and features a queen sized bed, a large walk-in closet and empty chest of drawers.
The smaller bedroom is located next to the larger bedroom and is accessible by the bed
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Jersey City is an historic neighborhood with many townhouses and brownstones, and lots of cafes and (great) restaurants! It is very diverse and lively, as well as a quiet respite from hectic New York life! It's very easy and fast to access Manhattan thanks to the Path train (see below).
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: We love to travel and meet new people. Bob is originally from Connecticut and Francois from France, we've been living in NY/NJ for twenty years. We also like art, music and movies. And we both speak French and English! Due to our busy schedule, one of us will be your host in the listing of your choosing. Welcome to Jersey City and New York!

Security video camera so you can feel secure at my property. Street parking requires a daily $5.00 permit from Monday through Friday). Cars are constantly moving around. name: Luxury 1BR Apartment in Jersey City near PATH
description:
Located at the Jersey City waterfront with breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, these sleek apartments feature spacious, sun-filled floor plans, fully-equipped, gourmet kitchens, and much more. This full lifestyle building offers amenities including a 7th floor terrace with resort-style pool, spa, lounge areas, BBQ grills, double-sided fireplace, and outdoor billiards, a state-of-the-art fitness center with yoga studio, and a children’s indoor playroom.

The space
Your new home is beautifully designed with luxury features including granite kitchen counter tops, hardwood floors & carpeting, walk-in closets, in unit washer/dryer, individual heat/air conditioning and alarm system.

Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens and towels.

Property amenities include:

• Controlled access
• Meeting room
• Clubhouse
• Large fitness center with new equipment
• Su
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment building is located adjacent to Harsimus Cove Light Rail Station, one block from Newport Centre Mall, and steps from the Newport Path. Guests can enjoy local entertainment and delicious eatery from the local shops and restaurants located within walking distance.
This location is one of the most walkable neighborhoods in Jersey City; not only for business but also leisure travelers. Jersey City is a hub of industry with its oil refineries, warehouses, and plants. Although known for its industrial prowess, Jersey City’s gem is Liberty State Park, which offers impeccable views of Manhattan, the Statue of Liberty, and Ellis Island.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

neighborhood_overview: The property is conveniently located about 25 minutes from Newark Liberty International Airport. Public transportation is also easily accessible – shuttle service to PATH/Ferry & just a short walk to the NY Waterway Ferry, Hudson-Bergen light rail, and the PATH.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: 2 bdrm private apt in great area, 7 min-NYC
description:
This is a spacious, fully renovated, fully stocked & functioning kitchen, 2 bedroom apartment located in a historic home with your own private entrance. It is newly renovated, very clean and has quality furniture, bedding and towels. The location is great --downtown JC on a lovely, safe block, 5 min to Grove Street Path, less than 15 min to NYC, near great restaurants and bars, short walk to waterfront! Perfect spot to stay and go site-seeing, visit family, or for a work trip.

The space
This is the ground floor apartment in a 4 story-2 family home. There is a separate entrance that opens into a spacious living space and fully stocked kitchen w/dishwasher. The hallway leads to 2 separate bedrooms, and a full-sized bathroom, with bathtub. There is a washer, dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker, pots, pans, utensils, plates, cups, bowls and many other kitchen items. There is a flat screen tv with all premium channels and WiFi and a table to work.

Gue
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is ideally situated, less than a 5 minute walk to the Grove Street PATH station which allows you to be in downtown NYC in less than 15 minutes.  Newark Avenue, which is full of restaurants and bars, is also just two blocks away.

name: Park View
description:
Sunny, quiet apt overlooking park, a quiet place to chill and easy to get to all the sites. No other people will be there

To go to manhattan take a $7 Uber or $3 bus, which stops right in front to the Journal Square and board the NJ Path train.

At journal square take the $3 path train to manhattan, about 10-15 min, from there you can transfer to all nyc subways. The Path train is clean and safe, the manhattan station is brand new with Apple store

The space
My apartment is private, no other people will be there. It overlooks Lincoln Park - 250 acres with fountains, tennis and jogging. It’s a Sunny 4th floor apartment overlooking beautiful Lincoln Park. Located in pre-war, elevator building with modern funishings.

The neighborhood Is a sleepy area on a residential street, there are a few cafes nearby and a real old-time neighborhood pub called New Park Tavern down the block that Yelpers love. The apt is clean and nicely cared f
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is sleepy and safe. But like all cities, you need to be a smart travelers especially at night. There are some basic stores on West Side Ave and a cool old-skool irish bar a block away.  The Park, directly across the street is is great for running and hanging out in - lots of open spaces and fountains.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
I'm a fairly easy going person and having been part-time living in NYC for several years. My wife and I started the restaurant Northeast Kingdom in Bushwick years ago and recently decided to close it and move on to other things. 

I still love cooking and all things about food. We run a small farm stand now at our house/garden  in the Hudson Valley. We have chickens and grow flowers and make pesto and pickles...and we have kids. So were are pretty busy most of the time. I like it that way. 
I listen to music - Bon Iver to the specials and sometimes play guitar badly.
I love reading but don't do enough of it. Last book I read my have been Harry Potter because our son was reading it as well.
I'm clean and organized and it's reflected in our apartment.
We are not there much because we live upstate but it's very nicely furnished with everything you need to have a sweet landing pad, and it's right on the park!

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. neighborhood_overview:
Modern residences across the 300-acre community, which is home to 15,000 people, feature spacious, light-filled apartments with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. Residences feature open layouts with hardwood floors, oversized windows, 24-hour doorman services, parking and laundry facilities. Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and children’s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the community’s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.

name: Beautiful Garden Studio with Easy Access to NYC
description:
Beautiful newly renovated studio close to New York City and fun New Jersey sights!. Get on the subway or bus and get to Manhattan in minutes. Our studio is great for solo, couples, small family, or business travelers and there's everything you need to make your stay comfortable. We are also a 12 minutes car ride to the new American Dream mega mall! By staying with us, you're helping support two Broadway actors pay their mortgage during these uncertain times. Thanks!

The space
Newly renovated ground floor apartment with backyard access for your furry friends! New Queen sized Performa Sleep mattress. Washer/Dryer in unit. Lots of closet space as well, and a big six drawer dresser when you want to unpack and put your suitcase away. We also have a blowup twin mattress for a third family member should you need it. Kitchenette (small fridge, microwave, toaster oven, hot plate, and coffee maker) is in the suite to make sure you're able to cook during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Great restaurants downtown Jersey City (20 minute walk), cafes and shops are nearby as well. 2 different options for parking: $10/day parking in a driveway near our house or Journal Square Path subway has a big lot, check online for current pricing.

There are also two Citi Bike Stations (Bike sharing program) within 5-7 minutes walk (Jefferson Avenue and Beacon Avenue). Great way to get around and there are stations downtown Jersey City, at Liberty State Park and all over so you can check out everything and not have to worry about parking.

host_about: Proud Canadian living in Jersey City, NJ, Broadway Actor, CrossFitter, husband. Life is good.

Victorian home with full renovation preserving the original details. Parquet floors, beautiful woodwork, backyard. New kitchen with premier appliances. Washer and dryer in basement. Great location, close to Journal Square Path Station only 20 minutes to NYC, Newark International Airport, Lincoln Park, Liberty State Park, Downtown Jersey City, and lots of restaurants, bars and cafes. Great home for family vacation. Jersey City Permit #STR21-00063

The space
We have a large, quiet house with a big backyard and a parking space. The home has been meticulously restored with an especially great kitchen for cooking.

Guest access
Guest have access to the whole house, except for a small office where we keep our personal belongings. There are 2 bedrooms and we have a Japanese futon - queen size, which can be used on the living room floor for sleeping.

Other things to note
Our house is a 10-15 minute walk to the Journal Square Pa
neighborhood_overview: This is a residential neighborhood with very friendly families. There are plenty of places to walk to for eating and drinking.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
We are a family who loves to travel and experience new adventures. We are happy to call Jersey City our home during the school year, Hanoi our home during the summers and Shandaken our getaway in between. Whenever we can we head out into nature and try to eat new foods, which we then recreate in our own kitchen.

We have been staying at Airbnbs for years, and try to be the best hosts we can based on our own experiences. We will be very informative on what goes around in our neighborhood, and let you know the ins and outs of the area. We are friendly and easy to communicate with and want all our guests to have a memorable experience.  Nothing makes us happier than someone wanting to stay at our house again and again. We love our home and can't wait for others to enjoy it as well!

I have a few rooms in my house that I would like to host guests who are respectful of space, clean, friendly, and looking for a cozy place to stay while visiting the most exciting and hectic city of the big apple.

description:
Fully renovated Garden Level Apartment of historic home w/ private entrance. Just 10 min. to NYC on PATH & steps to Downtown Jersey City restaurants, shops, waterfront & bars. Flat screen TV, WiFi & fully stocked kitchen & bath. Watch a movie on premium cable (HBO, etc.), cook a yummy dinner from the Farmers' Market, or just relax. Laundromat right across the street. Perfect spot to have as a home base while you work, visit family or explore NYC!

Jersey City permit #STR20-00021

The space
Have the entire garden level, 2 bedroom apartment of this historic 1840s home all to your self! With your own private, keyless entry, this will truly feel like home. Completely renovated with everything you could possibly need - including central A/C & heating - and even closer to Manhattan than many parts of NYC! This unit is only used for airbnb rentals, so it is outfitted to cater to your exact needs. The unit is professionally sanitized between guests.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the historic heart of Jersey City - a vibrant, diverse neighborhood with excellent restaurants and a burgeoning art scene just minutes from downtown Manhattan.  Be sure to check out Kitchen Step, South House, Skinner's Loft, Downtown Yogurt, Van Hook Cheese and Pasta dal Cuore.  Take a stroll down our beautiful streets lined with historic brownstones, and have a cup of coffee in one of the many parks.  Don't miss a short walk to the waterfront for amazing views of Manhattan!

This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. The upscale, pet-friendly building’s amenities include a 24-hour attended lobby, fitness center with yoga studio, children's playroom, pool with sundeck, billiards room, lounge and more. The surrounding area of downtown Jersey City is vibrant and historic, with plenty of restaurants, museums, shopping and parks waiting to be explored. The space

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. It is also one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world, with large populations of Hispanic, Asian and Indian Americans. The Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) train, a 24-hour s

On the 1st level is the kitchen, dinning area & work space. On the 2nd floor is the bedroom, full bathroom & walk in closet. The apartment has access to private outside decks on both levels. Aside from the proximity to Manhattan the apartment is 2 mins. from the Liberty State Park ferry and NY water taxi.

The space
Unit Amenities — Fully furnished, bedding, table linens, dinnerware, flatware, bathroom accessories, towels, cleaning supplies, new washer/dryer, Fully-Equipped kitchen with basic kitchen electronics, stainless steel appliances & Quartz countertops, Poland Springs water cooler, walk in closet, pantry, Hardwood flooring, ceramic tile, spacious closets, 2 flat screen TVs, basic cable TV and wifi complimentary.
* Cleaning service is available for an additional
neighborhood_overview: Paulus Hook is a Jersey City neighborhood that is very Convenient. The apt. is located just minutes away from hidden gem restaurants and local shops, the property is also just a short ferry ride to midtown / downtown manhattan. Our apartment sits two blocks away from two path train stations and a block away from the Light Rail Train, that would put you anywhere you need to be in NYC and within New Jersey without any stress.

name: Beautiful, clean, pvt bedroom 30 min to TIMES SQ!
description:
This lovely, quiet and well designed space is a 1 min walk from frequently running buses that will have you in times square in about 35 min. There is a liquor/convenience store around the corner. There is a park featuring tennis courts, year round indoor pool, seasonal ice skating rink and Manhattan skyline views, two blocks away. There are a variety of small restaurants in walking distance. The neighborhood is very quiet comfortable and safe at all hours.

The space
The room features 42 inch tv, leather clubman chair w/ottoman, full size bed, standing closet with iron and blowdryer. Attractive details through out. The livingroom is Paresian influenced minimalist decor. There is a country style eat in kitchen with a corner knook. All very clean, comfy and cozy.

Guest access
Eat in kitchen, living room, private bedroom, shared bathroom.

Other things to note
We provide towels, wash clothes, body wash, shampoo and tooth p

There are a variety of small restaurants in walking distance. The neighborhood is calm comfortable and safe at all hours.
