name: Private Room @EXCHANGE PLACE, Historic Jersey City
description:
Greetings friends! Welcome to my quaint abode :-) The apartment is a large 2 bed, shared 1.5 bath with quick walk to NYC transportation, rooftop patio, limited kitchen access, and paid laundry. It is on the 5th floor with elevator or walk up access. Private room with new queen bed and linens, AC, wireless 5G wifi, ample closet space with hangers, and 420 friendly. Shared 50" TV with Chromecast Ultra, no cable. ***PLEASE READ PROFILE IN ITS ENTIRETY BEFORE BOOKING*** ~NO OVEN/STOVE ACCESS~

The space
Spacious NYC/ Village-style apartment with views of lower Manhattan, comfortable shared living space and clean spacious bathrooms. Large kitchen and laundry facilities in basement. Rooftop access to patio with gorgeous views and lovely sunsets. The building is between and elementary school and a church, in a picturesque neighborhood of Brownstones, small shoppes and quaint dining establishments.

Guest access
Quick walk to Exchange Place PATH **3
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood has many varied pros: great restaurants, close proximity to NYC, parks and is a family neighborhood. Compared to NYC, this is a quiet area, so those looking to relax will find it a better fit than anyone looking for all night parties and bars that never close.
When you're here, the apartment has beautiful southern exposure, AC units in all rooms, rooftop access to patio with views of Hudson River and Lower Manhattan.

neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Jersey City is brimming with activity! With its close proximity to NYC, the area has seen a rapid development in the past 7 years and is now home to a diverse mix of locals, restaurants, bars and businesses. Just take a look on Yelp and you will find over 50 places to eat and drink at that are rated 4 STARS and above, all within a 10 minute walk from the apartment! In addition, there is Newport Mall nearby, which has a lot of shopping options (H&M, Zara, Coach, G-Star, Macys, Footlocker to name a few) a cinema and a diverse food court.

In our opinion, there are only 3 areas in New Jersey that are worth staying in if you are visiting NYC for a vacation or for business. Downtown Jersey City, Historic Jersey City and Hoboken due to their transport links to Manhattan, great local bars and restaurants, and for being known as incredibly safe areas.

neighborhood_overview:
Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike. It was previously an independent municipality that formally became part of Jersey City in 1870. Offering luscious green parks, the Riverview Arts District and bustling thoroughfares dotted with shops and restaurants, it’s clear the Heights is making its name as a premier destination. The house is located on a quiet and safe tree-lined street with direct access to Citi Bike and shopping and restaurants located on Central Avenue.
Jersey City Heights is very diverse neighborhood – Spanish, Italian, Indian, Asian, and many other ethnicities and a variety of food choices. The area has become a destination for young professionals, working in Manhattan and living in Jersey City, NJ. There is a large mix of many ethnicities and many people are choosing to live in Jersey City because of it and the low cost compared to Manhattan. You get the best of both worlds w

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very safe and full of character. The house is located across from the newly built Journal Squared Tower and 2 blocks away from the Jehovah Witness Kingdom Hall in Journal Square. It is actually located in the center of Journal Square. There are numerous grocery stores, bakeries, coffee shops and restaurants steps away. City cafe, Whealth cafe, Rasoi, Emma's,   Star Bucks and the Dunkin' Donuts. You have access to Jersey City's Little India on Newark Avenue, just a few blocks away. Try some local fan fare or take a walk to the PATH station to go downtown or into Manhattan! WE ARE 3 TRAIN STOPS AWAY FROM DOWN TOWN MANHATTAN!!!
host_location: New Jersey, United States
host_about: I was born and raised in India where I received my formal education. I am currently a physical therapist and have been practicing for the past 30 years. He has been a full time government employee for the past 29 years and a part time adjunct professor at Rutgers University. We both enjoy the hospitality business and do our best to make our guests feel at home.  In our spare time, we enjoy cooking and gardening with our children.  Please  come stay a while and enjoy our home.

The space
Private Entry. The unit is below grade yet has good lighting. The building is a 200 year old brick brownstone style dwelling. The air conditioner is a window unit. Comfort was a main goal , this was expressed in the queen memory foam mattress in each room as well as the gel infused pillows for a restful night after all the touring of the city sights. name: Chic Large Family home! Quick train or bus to NYC!
description:
Our hip urban home is a great base for your family gatherings or City adventures! Gorgeous chef's kitchen, two 55" TVs with speedy WiFi (Netflix, Hulu, etc). Ideal for groups of 6 to 10 (but sleeps up to 17!). Vibrant family-friendly neighborhood, a short 20 min. walk to Journal Square PATH station which has buses & trains to NYC, Hoboken and Newark Airport, all within a 10-25 min subway ride. Our family lives in the downstairs attached home. Ask about on-site childcare & renting parking spaces.

The space
We are a local family, not absentee landlords. We live in the attached home below, but your home will have its own private, locked entry and entirely private spaces.

Built over a century ago, our fully-renovated 3 bedroom/2 bath home includes a well-lit Victorian double salon with high ceilings and a spacious attic bonus room (a great hideaway for kids and teenagers— or couples who want a big bed for each to sleep on) where there are two queen beds,
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a gem with the best view of the Manhattan skyline and a 7 min drive to the Statue of Liberty! Hoboken, home of Carlo's Bakery, is our next door neighbor. Our neighborhood is especially family friendly and walkable. Enjoy tennis, picnicking, bike trails and multiple playgrounds, all within a 3-minute walk from your home away from home. Just around the corner is a Catholic church, an array of ethnic eateries, a Dairy Queen, convenience stores, fruitstands, hair salons, etc.

We are also close to Liberty State Park, where you can catch a ferry to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, or to NYC!
host_location: Fair Oaks, California, United States

We are the parents of three young adults, and former foster parents; Mike is a professor and Kennan teaches at a cancer hospital in NYC. We consider ourselves to be committed to our community. 
We speak Spanish (though we are rusty).  Kennan can sign (though she is rusty too). But we would love to get some practice. 
We find great joy in hosting people and families from all over the world!

name: Stylish Apt 40 mins from NYC - TV, Parking, W/D
description:
Monthly renters welcome.

Rent this tastefully decorated, sun drenched one bedroom urban apartment 40 minutes away from Manhattan. Located 2 blocks from the light rail train in the bustling Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City, this unit features a driveway for parking, plush queen bed, an extra air mattress, 49" LED TV, Netflix and WiFi, fully equipped kitchen, walk-in shower, and in-unit laundry. You will be steps away from parks and trendy restaurants.

The space
This apartment has been updated to feature a mix of modern design and old-world brick townhouse charm. Everything you need is provided - fresh towels, tissue paper, soaps/shampoo/bodywash, cooking utensils and new appliances. Ground coffee and coffee maker in the kitchen will power your mornings and prepare you for a full day of NYC sightseeing.

Guest access
You may park your vehicle in the gated driveway in front of the house and enjoy a small backyard area in
neighborhood_overview:
Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Uber is very popular in Jersey City, and a ride between the apartment and the PATH station at Exchange Place in Downtown won't cost more than $10. They will take a group of 4 people, which means your cost per-person will be lower than the $2.5 light rail ticket. If you haven't used Uber before, let me know and I will send you an invite which comes with a small discount.

This cozy Private Room is located in the Jersey City area, you'll have easy access to the best things New York City has to offer. You can be as social or as private as you like, we just want you to enjoy your stay to the fullest. We'll be more than happy to assist you in anything we can!

We offer a comfortable Full & Twin Size (Real
neighborhood_overview:
Guests will be located close to everything in a very safe neighborhood. The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

The following popular places are VERY accessible (By train, bus, or walking):

- Pershing Field Park (Pool, Tennis, Picnic, 2 Baseball Fields, Jogging Track) *Walking Distance.
- River View Park (Great view and to take pictures of New York) *Walking Distance.
- Loew's Jersey Theater *Walking distance\bus
- Liberty State Park (Here you can see an up close of the Statue of Liberty and\or even take the ferry to the Island itself) *Bus\Train
- Liberty Science Center (Museum) *Bus\train - Same stop as Liberty State Park
- Jersey City Museum (Uber\Bus)
- Museum of Russian Art (Uber\Bus)
- Ellis I

name: Huge 25 foot LOFT just $52 only 3 blocks from PATH
description:
A huge spacious loft 20 x 25 ft. King-sized bed, dorm-sized fridge, WIFI, air-conditioner. Flooded with light from 2 Skylights and three windows. Furnishings are an eclectic mix of period pieces. Work Area; Dining Area: oak dining table and chairs. Cozy Sitting Area: futon sofa. Dressers, Clothes cabinet, bookcases. Kitchen and bathroom are shared. The bathroom is located on the second floor and the loft is located at top floor large Row House. We are in a National Historic district.

The space
The LOFT is a very spacious, quiet, light-filled space within a very large row house located downtown on a lovely tree-lined street

Guest access
Parking is extremely difficult and only available with a permit for locals. However, there are lots of public transportation options: PATH train, light-rail train, local low cost van service.

Other things to note
House cat on premises
neighborhood_overview: A few block away is  the Pedestrian Plaza near the Grove Street PATH Station located many restaurants and drinking establishments. Also a few blocks away you can walk to Liberty State Park and the Hudson river. The PATH runs 24/7 into WTC and 33rd St NYC.

name: Luxury JC Condo, 3 blks PATH, 2 stps Manhattan WTC
description:
Downtown completely renovated 2nd story Historic Brick Condo 3 blocks from PATH subway access (2 stops World Trade and West Village), guaranteed parking 1 block away, 15 min drive to NYC. Perfect for business travelers or visiting couples w/ convenient NYC access, high speed internet access and 32" monitor, printer. You'll love the Jules Verne themed dining area and lavish amenities.

The space
We purchased and renovated the place, gutting the plaster interior and exposing the original 1852 brick to build our fantasy condo. The condo is on the second floor (1 flight of steps) of an apartment building across from City Hall and 3 blocks from downtown Jersey City with upscale restaurants, entertainment and shopping.

The first thing you see opening the door to the condo is the brick wall illuminated by a dozen halogen spots giving the interior a warm cozy feeling. The dining area we call the “Nautilus corner” was themed from the Jules Verne story and includ
neighborhood_overview: We are in the heart of the downtown Jersey City district.  1/2 block away is Grove Street which has many restaurants and bars.  3 blocks away is Newark Avenue which is a pedestrian street (closed to traffic) where the heart of 20+ eateries of every imaginable cuisine.

Inside this fabulous high-rise offering the latest in amenities & services like an outdoor heated pool & spa, a fitness center, a theater room, a playroom, & a sophisticated club room, you will find well appointed apartments with nine foot ceilings, fully-equipped designer kitchens, and hardwood floors. name: Modern "hotel suite" type studio apt near Grove st
description:
Beautifully design studio, with state of the art amenities, gives you a hotel suite type feel with a homely atmosphere.

The studio offers comfortable queen size bed and a work desk. Also, the over-sized windows floor to ceiling windows provides sufficient sunlight.
PATH train station is just a 10 min walk. You can take a direct train from here to NYC. Light rail station is across the street, for travel within jersey city.

Studio is set up with a first aid kit, pots & pans, and dinnerware.

The space
Beautifully design studio, with state of the art amenities, gives you a hotel suite type feel with a homely atmosphere, gracious kitchen, spa-like bathrooms and modern appliances. The studio offers comfortable queen size bed and a work desk. Also, the over-sized windows floor to ceiling windows provides sufficient sunlight.

PATH train station is just a 10 min walk. You can take a direct train from here to NYC. Light rail station
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City’s Grove Street is one of the best places to live and merely 7 minutes train ride (PATH) to Manhattan. It has beautiful waterfront,  park, stylish restaurants, cafes, bars, spas and shops. This area has a peaceful appeal with the neighboring Liberty Landing Marina. Also, this area is pretty safe and very livable.

name: BRIGHT HOMEY AND COZY  MINUTES TO NEW YORK  CITY
description:
A beautiful private apartment close to NYC in less than 30 minutes, Buses around the corner, located in a quiet and safe neighborhood, near all stores and Restaurants, Kitchen, bathroom tub/shower, Two double bed-size, 12 inches bed/memory foam mattress, recliner chair and comfortable couch in living room

The space
It's cozy and quiet - you will feel at home upon arrival - Private home with three apartments. This listing is for our second floor apartment which is a walk up

Guest access
You have full access to the entire apartment during your stay. The entire Apartment is only for the use of our guests not share with anyone else

Other things to note
There is only Street parking available and needs a visitor parking permit that cost $5 daily
We have USB plugs available
neighborhood_overview:
This cozy and warm Apt located in a safe neighborhood, on a street full of families and great people. If you are looking for a friendly place to stay while you enjoy the area, we are it! and is close and walking distance to Restaurants and Supermarkets.
It’s two blocks from the bus stop to NYC public transportation takes you to Port Authority 42nd street Times Square buses runs very often every 5 to 8 minutes which We recommend.
"UBER" is in Jersey YAY!!! ;D download the app and travel around for cheap !
host_location: New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Kenia and I are parents of three beautiful children.  Our house is a family home that we cherish dearly. 

We love to host and are happy to join the Airbnb community to share our beautiful home with you. 

We enjoy going to museums - having family gatherings, music and of course good food.  

Look forward to having the opportunity to host you. 

Rod & Kenia

name: ❤️ Tiny House in the Garden | NYC | NJC l NEW
description:
The Garden Tiny House is a designer place, BRAND NEW, and mad COSY! New new new and awesome!

Stay in this charming, Garden Tiny House, a writer’s quaint dream, freshly re-designed and remodeled, while still holding 1900’s character.

Just minutes away from the beautiful Lincoln Park and a walk and a few path train stops away from The West Village and FiDi ( more about that in the Getting Around section )

The space
❤️“We absolutely loved our stay! We booked this for part of our honeymoon & loved it!”
❤️“The place was fantastic for my eleven year old daughter and me. It was exact as the photos shown on the application. It is so nicely decorated, that looks like a fairy tale house.”

Embrace the freedom of minimalistic living in this charming Garden Tiny House. While it has a 250 sq ft surface, it's built in mind with the small footprint principles and feels spacious and sunny. The giant windows offer plenty of natural light and t
neighborhood_overview:
Like the majority of affordable Airbnb listings in Jersey City and Brooklyn, our Tiny House is located in an up and coming neighborhood, further away from the crazy. As it consist of mostly residential houses, it’s quite and friendly. There is a grocery store and a few restaurants a couple of blocks away, and that specific street is in the middle of a gentrification process, but it’s totally safe.
The Lincoln Park around the corner is charming and my personal favorite thing about the neighborhood.
Get away from the busy and noisy Manhattan streets once you’ve enjoyed touristing around and enjoy a walk or morning jog in Lincoln Park! 👟🌳🌸

Street parking is easy to find ( a NYC metro area easy though, please keep that in mind:) )

Getting to NYC is easy peasy!
It takes 25min+ to get to Manhattan, depending on how you decide to get there.

Like driving?
It's about a bit 20 minute drive to get to Manhattan with no traffic.
Like to

Me and my hubby like to travel all over the world. We come back inspired to create special experiences and spaces that we love sharing with our guests in the NYC outer area.

Mommy of an orange tabby and an adorable dachshund mutt.

name: Luxury Private Jersey City One Bedroom Apartment
description:
Located at the Jersey City waterfront with breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, these sleek apartments feature spacious, sun-filled floor plans, fully-equipped, gourmet kitchens, and much more. This full lifestyle building offers amenities including a 7th floor terrace with resort-style pool, spa, lounge areas, BBQ grills, double-sided fireplace, and outdoor billiards, a state-of-the-art fitness center with yoga studio, and a children’s indoor playroom.

The space
Your new home is beautifully designed with luxury features including granite kitchen counter tops, hardwood floors & carpeting, walk-in closets, in unit washer/dryer, individual heat/air conditioning and alarm system.

Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens and towels.

Property amenities include:

• Controlled access
• Meeting room
• Clubhouse
• Large fitness center with new equipment
• Su
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment building is located adjacent to Harsimus Cove Light Rail Station, one block from Newport Centre Mall, and steps from the Newport Path. Guests can enjoy local entertainment and delicious eatery from the local shops and restaurants located within walking distance.
This location is one of the most walkable neighborhoods in Jersey City; not only for business but also leisure travelers. Jersey City is a hub of industry with its oil refineries, warehouses, and plants. Although known for its industrial prowess, Jersey City’s gem is Liberty State Park, which offers impeccable views of Manhattan, the Statue of Liberty, and Ellis Island.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Private room in historic Jersey City brownstone
description:
Situated a 5 minute walk away from the Grove Street PATH (~15min to Manhattan), this 19th century historic apartment is the ideal spot to experience vibrant downtown Jersey City and NYC! This apartment has abundant natural light and offers a spacious living / dining room and modern kitchen. The unit offers free in unit laundry, WiFi , Netflix/HBO Max on a 55" OLED TV, and a landscaped shared backyard with grill and seating. You'll wake up each day refreshed on a new Acovado queen size mattress.

The space
Historic charm (original hardwood floors, plaster moldings, and french pocket doors) meet modern luxuries (55" OLED TV, Wifi, Smart Lights, Espresso machine) in this gorgeous home.

Guest access
You'll be able to access all areas except the 2nd bedroom.
neighborhood_overview: This quaint and vibrant neighborhood offers beautiful architecture, parks, restaurants and bars all steps away from the property!
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Traveling around the planet and experiencing new cultures and places is a true passion of mine. When I travel, I love to immerse myself in the people and environment. I love learning how to cook new cuisine, explore the outdoors (hiking/kayaking), and visit museums and parks. 

As a guest, I am courteous and treat the home/apartment as my own. I enjoy receiving advice/recommendations from airbnb hosts, so please feel free to let me know what are the must dos/sees in your city!

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask!

name: Stylish Jersey City Apartment Close to NYC
description:
Cozy apartment steps away from transportation to midtown Manhattan. Close to stores, restaurants and parks in the thriving Jersey City Heights neighborhood. French-speaking hosts.

The space
The apartment has been recently renovated and is very well appointed. It is a garden-level apartment with a lot of light in the front of kitchen/living room.

Guest access
Guests will access the apartment through their own door (at garden level) and will also have access to our Washer and Dryer that are located just outside the unit.

Other things to note
If you are flying into Newark Airport, this is the perfect location as we are about 20 minutes away from the airport with easy and relatively inexpensive transportation options (Taxi and public Transportation). Note that we are a good two hours away from JFK and LaGuardia airports .
neighborhood_overview:
The Jersey City Heights area is comprised mostly of two and three family houses, and remains traditionally middle-class. Perched high atop the palisades on the western banks of the Hudson River, the Heights sits 100 feet above sea level and the City of Hoboken. Along the east are Palisade and Ogden Avenues, both of which offer stunning views of the Manhattan skyline especially when standing in Riverview Fisk Park.

"The Heights" is characterized as a traditional and mixed neighborhood community. The Central Avenue shopping district is home to more than 240 storefront businesses. Bordering the North end of the Heights is County owned Washington Park. Pershing Field park is located in the center of this district offering green space, baseball fields, an Olympic size swimming pool and ice skating rink. Adjacent to Pershing Field Park is Reservoir#3 which constitutes one of the largest patches of green space in the Heights.
(Adapted from http://www.jcheights.com/community-a

name: Newly-Renovated, Modern 1BR Apt in Prime Location
description:
Our recently-renovated, modern one-bedroom/one-bathroom apartment is situated in the garden level of a historic 200-year-old row house. The space features an open concept living room and kitchen, washer/dryer, queen bedroom, and full shower. Located on a tree-lined street in downtown Jersey City, the apartment is close to a beautiful park, trendy restaurants and bars, and shops and grocery stores. Paid parking is available nearby, and the PATH train into Manhattan is just a quick walk away!

The space
Our home is a recently renovated two-family historic wood row house. The home is set back from the street about 50 feet. You have a private entrance to the garden level apartment. The bedroom and living space each have individually remote-controlled heating and A/C units, so you have full control of temperature regulation. There is also a washer/dryer in the apartment. The kitchen has a full-sized refrigerator, range, dishwasher, microwave, drip coffee maker, and bas
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of Hamilton Park in Downtown Jersey City. The apartment is two blocks away from the park, which has tennis courts, a basketball court, a large playground, plenty of tree-shaded grassy areas for a picnic, and a farmers market on Wednesdays from May through November. Newark Avenue, a pedestrian-only street with lots of trendy restaurants and bars, is an 8-minute walk away. The Newport Mall, with plenty of shopping options and a large movie theater, is three blocks away. There are a number of other restaurants, as well as some great ice cream shops and several local coffee shops, within walking distance. There are also two grocery stores located within five blocks of the apartment (ShopRite and Key Food). See "Getting around" for transportation specifics.

The space
We are a Century’s old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms. All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, an Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi. The property is clean, safe and secure and is located in a quiet tree-lined residential neighborhood only one blo
neighborhood_overview: Magnolia House is just minuets from NYC!! You can also take the PATH train to explore Jersey City!! We are only two stops from Newport Mall & Exchange Place and not far from Liberty State Park. We are also walking distance to so much in the area! host_about:
We are an energetic couple that loves Nyc! My husband was born and raised in NY and I was born and raised in N.J.  We also have two beautiful children and a dog who is just as cute as our babies :) During our spare time when we’re not tending to our Airbnb guests we like to take walks by the jersey city water front, taking our kids to the park, eating out in the city, watching movies and traveling when we can!

description:
Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

The location is outstanding! Situated on a sought-after tree-lined residential street, and only a stone’s throw away from all the magic New York City has to offer.

The neighborhood is home to many fine restaurants & coffee shops.
Supermarket 2 blocs away.
Bakery around the corner.
World Trade Center and shopping malls 10min away.
Waterfront with amazing views of lower Manhattan 10min away perfect for jogging & biking.

The space
Private apartment situated on the 2nd floor of our brownstone. You will have access codes to two doors and be able to come and go as you please.

Guest access
Smart home.
Fully connected.
Self check in via smart lock.
USB ports on several outlets no adapter needed to charge your phone if you come from a foreign country.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the Harsimus Cove Historic Preservation Neighborhood in downtown Jersey City!

It's an outstanding location. Situated on a sought-after, tree-lined block of 150-year-old brick townhouses (think: Sesame Street), our home is only a stone's throw away from New York City and all the magic it has to offer.

Yet you may want to linger here, choosing to stroll the pedestrian street along Newark avenue and check out the many fine restaurants & coffee shops.

Key facts:
• Very safe at all hours
• Well-stocked local supermarket 2 blocks away (open till 10 pm nightly)
• Bakery around the corner
• Coffee shop around the other corner
• BYOB brick-oven pizza place two blocks away
• 7-minute walk to Grove Street PATH train (6-minute ride to WTC)
• One World Trade Center tower and shopping malls 13min away
• Jersey City waterfront, with some of the most amazing views of lower Manhattan, is a 10min walk
• Biking/jo

neighborhood_overview: The property is conveniently located about 25 minutes from Newark Liberty International Airport. Public transportation is also easily accessible – shuttle service to PATH/Ferry & just a short walk to the NY Waterway Ferry, Hudson-Bergen light rail, and the PATH.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: ❤️ Large&Sunny Apartment Close To NYC ❤️
description:
Charming 3BR/1 BA - sleeps 2-6

Come stay in this stylish apartment, 25+ minutes away from Manhattan. A walk away from the beautiful Lincoln Park and close to Little India where you'll have the tastiest Indian food everrrrr.

Close access to NYC by the Path train, especially World Trade Center, Statue of Liberty, the West Village and Tribeca, the hippest coolest neighborhoods in NYC. 15 minutes drive from the Newark airport.

The space
❤️“Very stylish home! Very clean and comfortable space! Accommodations were much better than anticipated”

The apartment is large and sunny, featuring a huge master bedroom with a large closet and lots of natural light coming from the bay windows. There is another private bedroom, and a bedroom that you walk through to get to the master one. The space feels spacious and private. Large galley style kitchen with stainless appliances and lots of natural light, great for family or friends get togethers.
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is the unofficial 6th borrow of NYC. Only a couple of blocks away from the Lincoln Park, with 23 tennis courts, bike lanes and other exciting activities.
Like most budget friendly Airbnb listings in Jersey City and Brooklyn, ours is located in an up and coming neighborhood, in the process of gentrification. That allows us to give you more value and space :). There are a lot of families and young professionals living in the area.

Very close to JW convention hall.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Art Director&Designer working in advertising. I love all things pretty, colors and nature.

Me and my hubby like to travel all over the world. We come back inspired to create special experiences and spaces that we love sharing with our guests in the NYC outer area.

Mommy of an orange tabby and an adorable dachshund mutt.

name: Spacious 4BR home 30 mins from NYC! Parking avail!
description:
Cozy home perfect for a getaway or holidays around NYC: 30 mins to NYC. 4 Bedroom, 2.5 Bath. Sleeps 6-14. Private coded entrance. 2 stories.

Our home was built in 2017 and is filled with beauty products and all the amenities you need! 25 mins from World Trade Center, 35-40 mins from Times Square, 20 mins from Newark Airport, 15 mins from American Dream.

Extra $25/day 2-car max parking available with advance notice. Large vans are $40.

Jersey City Short Term Rental Permit STR20-00032

The space
Welcome the metro New York City area in the heart of New Jersey!

*As a note: we are working extra hard to provide cleanliness and safety during Covid and can assure guests we follow all rules/guidelines set by airbnb including extra time between guests.

With a bus stops within three blocks of our home, get to Port Authority (Times Square) in 30-40 minutes OR World Trade Center, Macy's, Union Square, The West Village a
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is close to NYC and has a variety of public transportation options. Neighboring Hoboken and downtown Jersey City are both easy 15 minute walks and have plenty of lovely options for dining and entertainment. 20 minutes from Newark airport.

We are 6 miles from MetLife stadium, home to the Giants and Jets. Appr. 15 minutes via Uber or car.

We provide maps and bus/train instructions for NYC travel. The fastest to Herald Square (Macys's) is (a) 16 min walk to PATH at Journal Square, then 20 min train to 33rd street. Or take 3 minute bus to PATH for faster service. PATH drops at Christopher Street, 9th street, 14th street (Union Square), 23rd street and 33rd street (Macy's). There is also a separate Path Service line directly to the World Trade Center (about 10 minutes on the train).

There are also direct buses that get you to Times Square (Port Authority) in about 35 to 45 minutes that pickup directly outside of our street.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: Hello future friends - my husband, Ted, and I love traveling the world. (So much that we have been to Norway, New Orleans, London, Maine, Austin, Nashville, Toronto, Hawaii, Croatia, Venice, Switzerland, South Africa, Alaska, Portland and Napa in recent years.)  I hail from the midwest (Wisconsin) and love ice cream, cheese and the Packers.  Ted is from Brooklyn and knows everything about NYC + he was an MLB baseball player. We live for country music, half marathons and live music.  We hope to see you at our home or yours! Our goal as Airbnb hosts is to give a purely local and delightful home-away-from-home. See you soon!

name: ⭐Minutes to NYC⭐ Brownstone beauty | FREE PARKING
description:
Urban energy, brownstone charm! Welcome to bustling Journal Square in Jersey City!

We renovated our beautiful 19th century brownstone and installed brand-new everything, from appliances to bathroom fixtures. The front bedroom has a queen bed; the rear smaller bedroom has a double bed that looks out onto our serene backyard. Since we live downstairs we're happy to help make your stay as pleasant as possible.

The space
COMPLIMENTARY:
-Free parking for one car
-Luggage storage before and after check-in and check-out time
-In addition to cable TV- Netflix included

LOCATION HIGHLIGHTS:
-Train station to NYC is 7 blocks from our house (entrance is on the same street). We are 3 stops from Manhattan. Trains run 24/7 into NYC.
-Grocery store, wine shop, Spanish restaurants, gym/fitness center are on our block.
-Great Italian/pizza parlor, amazing New American restaurant, laundromat, and pharmacy are down the block from
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very safe and family friendly. Like NYC, the neighborhood is cultural diversity. Jersey City has been gentrifying for the last few years.  We have seen an influx of young professionals and families like ourselves move into this beautiful, vibrant city. We have lived in Jersey City for eight years with our three young kids (3,5,7) and Tim's family has been here for 100+ years.

A couple of blocks from us is an elementary school, catholic high school, Saint Peter's University, churches, and the New Jersey National Guard Armory.

There is a grocery store, wine shop, diners/restaurants right around the corner. One of the best bagel places in the NYC/NJ area is just a few blocks away. Little India, a 15-minute walk away, has some of the best restaurants around and there are plenty of dining options closer to Journal Square.

Our house is:
-1/2 mile (7 blocks) from Journal Square Path (train) Station to NYC
-4 miles from Lower M

We have been hosting for almost  three years now.  Our hosting experience has definitely expanded our worldview and appreciation of other cultures.

name: Jersey City Apartment Close to Path Train to NYC
description:
Spacious one bedroom apartment ideal for an individual or couple visiting New York City or Jersey City. The apartment is a ten minute walk or short Uber to the Journal Square Path station which has you in New York City in 15 minutes. Door-to-door you can be in the West Village or World Trade Center in less than half-an-hour. The apartment is also a 20 minute walk to both the Hoboken Waterfront and the vibrant Downtown Jersey City neighborhood. With NYC views as well, this place has great value!

The space
You will have the entire apartment to yourself: common area, kitchen, bathroom and bedroom. There is also a common outdoor patio and basement laundry if you need to use it. You'll need to bring the building key with you to access these spaces. You must purchase a $20 laundry card to do laundry, but we can also make arrangements to leave my card if you Venmo me per cycle used.
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City Heights is a great neighborhood located on a palisade above Hoboken with Hoboken, Jersey City, and New York City views (the apartment has New York City views).
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Hello!

My name is Ryan and I am a teacher and basketball coach here in New Jersey. I lived in Brooklyn for many years and moved to my current apartment in Jersey City a year ago.

I enjoy traveling a lot so when my apartment is available it's usually because I am off on an adventures somewhere else. When I'm home, I am out enjoying the adventures NYC has to offer pretty much every weekend, or exploring more of Jersey City. 

Jersey City is great! It's pretty much like living in another borough of the city and am super happy with my move. There is a lot to do in the area and with the Journal Square path close by and NJ transit bus up the block, you can be in the city in 30 minutes door-to-door. I hope you get to enjoy my place!

Ryan

I am a young entrepreneur, I manage properties and vehicles by day, I go to school at night. I work hard in everything I do, I think im an extremely helpful individual. I was naturally born to provide hospitality/customer service/sales, at least that's how I feel! 

I am currently pursuing a degree in Hospitality, Management, & Entrepreneurship, graduation 2018. It is my life's pursuit to make the everyone's day a little brighter. I love to travel, meet new people, and just live. My favorite thing to do is, learn about the cultures of others where I visit,  and those who visit me.

My long term goal is to acquire international properties and luxury SUVs to manage & rent them. I actually embarked on hosting a condo in the always beautiful, Dominican Republic. 

I am moving one step at a time, one reservation at a time. I have been on this journey since September 2015 .Each guest that stays with me or rents one of my vehicles helps me get closer to my dreams. 

I sincerely appreciate anyone who decides to reserve one of my homes. 

I hope your stay is a dream come true too!

name: The Cook's Brickhouse *Walk to PATH!
description:
This stylish 2 bedroom renovated historic house is 20min to Manhattan/15min from Newark Airport. Take the 24-hr PATH (8 min walk) or Bus 51 (3min walk ) to NYC.
Shop local markets and cook in the chef's kitchen with a 6-burner Bluestar stove, or BBQ on the Weber grills in the yard with organic veggie garden, bamboo forest and fruit trees. Soak in the clawfoot tub or read a book from the cook's library.
There is a 28 night min stay. Please introduce yourself and tell me about your visit.

The space
The house is my home and I travel often. I'm happy to have good people enjoy the house as much as I do. It is extremely convenient, yet peaceful and quiet. Being so close to NYC, Newark airport and all major roadways is a great convenience.
The neighbors are great, we have a fantastic neighborhood full of culture and diversity and excellent restaurants. You can enjoy the growing community in Jersey City and spend a little less than you would in Manh
neighborhood_overview:
Check out my guidebook for recommendations!
The Journal Square area is old and gaining ground with occasional classic films playing at the historic Loews Theater across from the Path Station.
•The Mana Contemporary Art Center is around the corner.
•Square 1 Community cafe is 2 doors down serving excellent food and coffees, drinks etc.
•Little India is a block away with shopping, fresh food, butchers and excellent restaurants.
•Convenience stores like the Dollar Store, a liquor store and small ethnic markets are easily available. There are ashrams as well and a yoga studio.
•Grove Street (Path station stop) is chock full of new restaurants that are delicious and now pedestrian in some areas. Shops and nightlife abound if you decide to stay in Jersey City. Jivamukti has an excellent yoga studio there as well.
•Exchange Place (Path station) has a direct ferry to Brookside Place (near WTC and the Oculus).
•Liberty State Park is a short ride away an

description:
Beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean garden level apartment in the best neighborhood in Jersey City. To concerned guests: Rest assured this airbnb is in a private historic house with a private entrance, private outdoor space without shared facilities.
BOOK WITH CONFIDENCE: We guarantee our guests absolutely clean apartment which includes multi-step CDC/W.H.O. sanitizing of all surfaces and linens between stays. This airbnb is LEGAL w all permits OR your stay is fully refundable.

The space
Apartment is on a garden (ground) level of a historic townhouse with a private entrance that has direct access to your private rear yard from both bedrooms.

Master bedroom (sleeps 2) has a comfortable hybrid (foam + innerspring) mattress queen bed with fresh linens and a nice sized closet.

Second bedroom (sleeps 2) has a bunk bed with sleep inducing 10" memory foam twin size mattresses and an open wardrobe with wide drawers.
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood for the perfect balance of walkability, diversity, and livability.   Smart travelers already know Downtown Jersey City is closer to Manhattan than 95% of Queens and Brooklyn with considerably less crowds.  Plus our mayor is young and progressive and fully legalized airbnb in 2015, unlike NYC where is very much illegal for short term rentals.  Our waterfront has one of the most picturesque views of lower Manhattan, New York Harbor and Statue of Liberty.    The apartment is two short blocks away from Hamilton Park surrounded by gorgeous brownstones and 19th century rowhouses, and it is adorned with impressive 100+ year old trees and lush glass within that often serve as gathering place for locals and visitors alike - the park hosts weekly farmers market, seasonal movie screenings, barbecue festivals, tennis and basketball courts, just to name a few. host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

name: Apt 3 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC
description:
You'll be staying on the 3rd floor of a 19th-century townhouse in downtown Jersey City. The house is one block from the Newark Avenue pedestrian plaza, with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. There's an ice cream shop (Torico) across the street. It's a five-minute walk to the Grove Street PATH station, where you can get the train to New York City or Hoboken. Door-to-door time to downtown NYC is about 20 minutes.

Jersey City Short-Term Rental Permit #STR20-00059

The space
The house was built in 1887 and is one of five identical houses at this end of the block. It was converted into a 3-family at some point, probably 1970s or 1980s. This apartment is the third (top) floor. The second floor is a separate Airbnb apartment, look for "Apt 2 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC."

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview: Our house is right in the middle of downtown Jersey City, one block from the Newark Ave pedestrian plaza, a two-block section of the street that closed to traffic. There are many shops and restaurants within a couple of blocks. If you are willing to walk a few more blocks you can reach ShopRite and Newport Mall. Hamilton Park is a 10-minute walk to the north, and to the south is Liberty Park and Liberty Science Center. The neighborhood is safe, and there are usually a lot of people around, so you won’t be alone.

name: Modern Apartment, with Garden, 30 Min from NYC
description:
Enjoy yourself in this modern apartment. The space features an open-concept interior, stylish furnishings and a cozy sectional couch.
It includes:
- Brand new 43 inch TV with CABLE (150 CHANNELS), Netflix & You-tube TV
- Renovated kitchen with quartz counter-top, new pots & pans
- Queen size and double size therapeutic bed mattress's
- Modern bathroom with stand in shower
- Fast internet
- Late check in/Check out
- Access to NYC 24/7 via PATH train/Light Rail in approximately 30 mins

The space
Living Room/Kitchen
- The apartment features an open living room and kitchen space. The kitchen has stainless steel appliances, quartz stone counter-tops, with a microwave, coffee maker, toaster and hot water kettle.
It also includes utensils, plates, cups, glasses and cooking pots. The living room includes a 43 inch TV with Netflix and Youtube TV (for main channels cbs/nbc/espn etc)
Bedroom/Bathroom
- The main
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in a residential/ urban area of Jersey City, however given its close proximity to Manhattan it makes it an ideal and economic place to holiday in. The surrounding neighborhood is not great per se, very working class however within 20 min you can be in downtown Jersey City or Manhattan. I would generally suggest taking an Uber in the evening, from the Path Station, which generally costs $10.00
The area is urban and 'up-coming';
Parking: Whilst there is street parking there are times, especially on the weekend that parking can be a bit of a challenge. The apartment is located on a dead-end street, and is in the inner city with many other cars around. During the week it is easy to find parking however on the weekend it can be tight.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I am young, 'trendy' (try to be) professional living in New York.  I moved to NY one year ago from London, although I'm originally from Australia. 

My style of Airbnb-hosting is to provide an extremely high standard - the best service and 'space' that I can, so that my guests enjoy themselves to the fullest.  Over the last few years I have had the pleasure of staying in many Airbnb places all around the world; and I have had wonderful experiences.  Now I want to return the favor, I want you to feel like you are in a 5 Star Hotel.   

Briefly about my career... Two years ago I moved out of the 'Start-up field' to start my own business in Real Estate, and haven't looked back since.  

My motto in life is cliche but true: You can get anything you want in your life as long as you put your heart and mind into it, whilst at the same time having a strong sense of integrity.

name: Lovely private bed/bath Paulus Hook, Jersey City
description:
Dear Airbnb Searchers,
We offer self check-in. We are double vaccinated but do not require that our guests be.

Activities that are described below reflect times BEFORE the current health concerns. CHECK for openings or closings.

Street parking is available and spaces are relatively easy to find. You need a visitor permit Mon. - Fri. Alternate side parking rules on Monday and Thursday. No permit needed on weekends/holidays. I provide permits for $10/day with advance notice.

The space
I understand that you may have concerns about staying in someone else's home.  I want to assure you that our home will be a safe space for you to enjoy. The 2nd floor bedroom and bathroom are completely private.   They are thoroughly cleaned and disinfected between each visit. Cleaning and disinfectant products will also be available for your use.  
The front entrance is shared by me, my husband, our tenant (who lives on the 3rd
neighborhood_overview:
We love the Paulus Hook neighborhood. We are five blocks from the Hudson River! The Freedom Tower in lower Manhattan is visible to the east as you stand in front of our house. There are convenient coffee and breakfast places just a couple of blocks away. I highly recommend the Light Horse Tavern, Amelia's and Taqueria, three of many great restaurants within a few blocks of our house.

Practically anything you want is really less than a 15 minute walk away! More excellent restaurants for foodies, WORD bookstore, specialty grocery stores, bakeries, live music, etc. I'm happy to provide recommendations for any activity or shopping need you may have.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: I am a costume designer and seamstress.  I am married to Tom, a retired architect. We have two daughters who live in NYC and Upstate NY.  Our son is an artist who lives in Bali.

host_location: Plainsboro Township, New Jersey, United States

David works full-time as an IT engineer in a bank, and a real estate investor too.

With a private entrance, outdoor space in the front and back, a chef's kit
neighborhood_overview: We're right in the heart of downtown Jersey City.   There's a terrific deli a few doors down, the best bagels EVER a block away and a French bakery around the corner.   We're 2 blocks from the local restaurant row, which is dotted with great places to eat and drink.  We're close to  grocery and drug stores and even have a spa across the street!  There are three beautiful parks within walking distance, including Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and The Statue of Liberty.   Everything you need is within walking distance.

name: Peaceful, Modern, Private, Clean Apartment!
description:
Private, modern, clean one-bedroom apartment with private front entrance and access to backyard garden.

The apartment is in a cozy + quiet residential area, with groceries & cafes nearby. Convenient to Manhattan: Journal Square PATH station is a 20 minute walk (or 5 minute bike ride or 10 minute local bus ride) away. The PATH gets you into downtown Manhattan in 11 minutes, to the West Village in 20 minutes, to Midtown in 27 minutes. Street parking is available on a first-come basis.

The space
The apartment is a newly renovated single-floor one-bedroom apartment with new finishes, new appliances, bright lighting and outfitted with modern, new furniture. There is access to the private backyard for some fresh air, cigarette break, or to enjoy a morning coffee while you plan your day. To access the outdoors you must pass through our utility room/shop, where my husband may be working from time to time, and which we ask for guests to be mindful when passin
neighborhood_overview:
As former NYC-dwellers, we love how quiet and convenient the McGinley Square neighborhood of Jersey City is compared to Manhattan or Brooklyn! Around the corner from our home is a fantastic coffee shop, Snapdragon, and across from them is a great bike repair shop. There is a wonderful jazz club (Moore's) up the street. Walking around the adjacent neighborhood you come across gorgeous brick homes built form the 1800's onward. Liberty State Park and Lincoln Park are both nearby for biking, jogging, and relaxing.

Lucky Farmer’s Market has great inexpensive produce so you can prepare meals at home. Exito grocery nearby is an inexpensive shop for produce and other needs.

Jersey City historic district is one subway stop over (or 5-minute drive or uber/lyft) at the Grove Street stop, and has many fantastic restaurants.

If your goal is to visit NYC, there is abundant public transportation options to get you there quickly. Extremely accessible to Newark Airp

This home will comfortably fit a family or friends where you can relax after long days of exploring NYC. We've worked to keep things light and simple with attention to bedding and towels. Our 1871 brownstone has great charm and character yet recently renovated to be cozy and modern. We love it and hope you will too!

The space
This cozy retreat is decorated simple and minimalistic. What we hope you find here are comfortable beds and feeling like you are at home when you walk through the door. neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is called Bergen Lafayette affectionately known as BeLa in Jersey City located just outside the very lively downtown Jersey City. It is walking distance to Liberty State Park which is a 1,200 acre park with dramatic views of the Manhattan skyline, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Liberty State Park offers outdoor activities for everyone to do such as bike riding, jet skis, kayaks and sailings etc. during the warmer months.

These are all also within walking distance from us which makes our place super convenient:

- For the best coffee, the Grind serves La Colombe coffee.
- For breakfast/lunch, Martha’s is next door or Cafe Lafayette by the light rail train station
- For lunch and dinner, go to Mordi’s Sandwich (for the best schnitzel), Pinwheel Garden (for ramen and Asian food) and Harry’s daughter (for great food, drinks and live music)
- For essentials, Uncle Dollar is next door
- For groceries, check out Ranch 9

neighborhood_overview:
Our property is a 7 minute walk to the Grove Street PATH train station which provides transportation to New York City, Newark Airport, Hoboken, etc. Depending on your destination, it is an approximately 10-20 minutes commute on the PATH train to Manhattan.

Jersey City is a melting pot of international influences from its residents to its varied and appetizing culinary options - Korean, Indian, Filipino, Cuban, Italian, and American.

The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islands are less than ½ mile away from Liberty State Park’s ferry dock. Liberty Science Center is a 10 minutes drive from Urban Base Camp. There are beautiful green spaces - Hamilton Park, Van Vorst Park, and Liberty Park - where kids can frolic and play, where you can walk, run, and cycle, take a picnic and gaze upon Manhattan’s skyline. The Newport area - one stop from Grove PATH station - offers you a mall, large stores, and a beautiful waterfront walkway.

The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

Jersey City Heights is a residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park offers sports courts and a playground.

name: Bright & open space at the Height of the Heights!
description:
New York City: 25 minute bus ride (bus stop across the street) to Port Authority/Time Square, or via the PATH (15 min bus ride or $7 Uber) to The World Trade Center!
A quiet, safe, open-concept, 2 bedroom apartment in Jersey City Heights. Bright and spacious with abundant natural light. The apartment can accommodate up to 9 guests. Living room converts into a third (walk through) bedroom w/sofa couch, bunk beds (twin&full) in the second bedroom. *More information in OVERVIEW section below*

The space
Hoboken, Downtown Jersey City and The American Dream mall are 5 to 15 minute cab rides away!

A parking is available for very compact cars. There is also an option to get a guest pass for street parking.

Grocery store is a 5 minute walk as well as restaurants, coffee houses and beautiful/scenic parks are nearby in every direction. Great for couples, families + kids, big groups, business travel and short term stay.

The space:
neighborhood_overview:
Small town feel in the up and coming Jersey City Heights.

Minutes away, you can walk to Washington Park in Union City. It is a large park with many activities for families or to take a romantic stroll to the cliffs where you can take in the view of the city. 10 minutes from Washington Park you can walk to Hoboken or The River-view Fisk Park where they finished a gazebo which has the most panoramic view of the City you could imagine.

Since I live seconds away from a major boulevard, it is simple to get to the Port Authority/Time Square ($3.75 - Jitney Bus) or World Trade Center! If you do not travel during rush hour, it only takes between 25 to 30 minutes to reach the heart of the city! With rush hour, it only adds an additional 15 minutes tops.

The MTA card you purchase in New York does not work with the buses in New Jersey (different states, so they do not share their money)

I am also steps away from many restaurants, D&D, coffee houses,

name: Cheerful Renovated Apartment by the Park
description:
Bright and newly-renovated apartment in our home, which is a quiet house next door to the park. The apartment has a private entrance and is self check-in with key box. Apartment has kitchen, private bathroom, study area w/ desk, and laundry.

The apartment can sleep 4 but we recommend 3 max. Bedroom has a queen-sized bed and a lounge area with TV w/ Netflix & cable. Entryway has a second bed for 2 more guests.

We are committed to the anti-COVID cleaning standards. We live on-site if needed!

The space
We note that although the apartment CAN sleep 4, it might not be the best set up for everyone. There is only 1 bedroom with a queen bed (for 2 guests), and the second bed is in the entryway / common area (for the 2 additional guests).

We have bikes to borrow, or there is also a Citibike station within walking distance. The park has great paths for biking, jogging, or casual strolls. We recommend going around by the fountain--also a g
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Hi - We’re a small family who splits our time between living in Jersey City and NYC. Burak is a journalist from Istanbul. Sarah is a lawyer who has lived in/around NYC for 11 years. We have two sons (born in July 2018 and January 2020), 2 cats, and a small dog. (The animals live in our Jersey City home but we don't allow them in the rented apartment.)

Let us know if you have any questions! We look forward to helping you explore the city and nearby areas.

name: NYC hideaway in Jersey City
description:
Convenient beautiful apartment will be your home base during your NYC holiday. Two private bedrooms with a wonderful open layout kitchen, dining and living room. There is a short walk to the NYC bound train and you are in midtown NYC in 20-30 minutes!! The PATH subway is a short walk from the apartment. The neighborhood has a grocery store, American style diner, Indian and Halal food. Also, an urban shopping strip with a nice selection of affordable clothes shopping.

The space
The apartment is very homey. It's very welcoming and quiet and close to a pharmacy, supermarket and laundromat. Your only a 15min walk to the path train into New York City.

Other things to note
There is no on the street parking available but if you wish to bring your car there is a pay parking lot available with $17 daily rates within a short distance from the apartment located at 2 Journal Square Plaza, Jersey City, NJ 07306
neighborhood_overview:
VIP diner is a 5 minute walk from apartment and is a classic American diner. There is a "Little India" 10 minutes from apartment with an entire subcontinent of Indian cuisine to sample. There are also halal restaurants in the area to enjoy.
The Journal Square shopping district is a nice clothes shopping area with affordable prices and a nice selection of styles.

I focus on detail and comfort level, because I understand after a long day of travel, you just want to lay on a comfortable bed and have a good night sleep. As a traveler myself, I turned my guest experience/expectation into hosting. I hope you find yourself at home here and return in the future. I am also very familiar with NYC attractions so I am able to provide lots of suggestion during your staying.

The space
Enjoy your staying at this beautiful newly renovated simple and Cozy style 2 bedroom with queen size beds and 1 full bathroom condo. It spacious living room with high quality furniture. Open concept kitchen with fully equipped kitchen supplies. Nice dining area fit up to 4 guests, perfect layout for a family staying! Each bedroom comes with its own decoration and complimented with high-end mattress to ensure you have a wonderful sleep every night.

neighborhood_overview:
Very safe area. We are surrounded by high rising buildings and nice restaurants. It is considered as the most safe area in Jersey city. we are also considered the best neighborhood in NYC in 2017 :)

I have lived in this neighborhood for 10 years and still deeply in love with it. I love hanging out in Manhattan, however, when I get back home, I want it to be quiet, safe and cozy. This is exactly how our neighborhood feels like. I like to walk to the waterfront to see the water and Manhattan skyline during Sunset time in a good day. (Do not miss it, it is worthy millions! :) . Our area is very quiet, yet, Walking 10 mins, you will get to the busy fun night life in Grove street area. Many new restaurants opened nearby. (we have 3 restaurant in 1 block!) and supermarket is within 10 mins walk too.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City was voted Most Diverse city in the United States in 2019.

You will notice this as you walk through Central Avenue ( 2 blocks away) which hosts cuisines from many ethnic backgrounds including Argentine, Colombian, Puerto Rican, Chinese, Japanese, American, Italian, Greek, and Ecuadorian cuisines, to name a few. Here, you will also find hair salons, nail salons, pharmacies, supermarkets, convenience stores, and novelty stores where you can find all kinds of odds and ends at reasonable prices.

name: MUST SEE New 2BR 20 Minutes to NYC - Sleeps 10
description:
Luxury, brand new 2 Bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. The neighborhood is clean and safe with a beautiful park and easy transportation to NYC (15 min drive or 20 min by bus to Times Square). Everything in the apartment is brand new: walls, floors, kitchen, bathrooms, all appliances, and furniture. It was decorated by a professional interior designer to create a functional, modern, luxurious space for you to enjoy. The apartment is equipped with everything you might need for a comfortable stay.

The space
The apartment features a full kitchen, two full bathrooms one with bathtub and one with shower. Queen bed (sleeps 2) in first bedroom, Queen bed (sleeps 2) and bunk bed (sleeps two) in second bedroom, 2 sofa beds (queen size, sleep a total of 4 people) in the living room. High-end brand new furniture (finished by a professional interior decorator). The apartment is located on the third floor of a walk-up building (no elevator). Please treat the space with respect. <
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in a great neighborhood. If your goal is to be close to NYC, pay lower rates, but also be able to enjoy the neighborhood where you are staying, then you found the right place. Across the street from the apartment is Riverview Fisk Park with a stunning view of Manhattan. Couple blocks away is Washington Park (Urban park with a playground for kids, baseball fields, tennis courts, and basketball hoops). Cute restaurant on the same block, coffee shop on the next block. Anything else you might need during your stay like pharmacy, supermarket, banks, and postal service is just steps away.

Sun filled home that is private and peaceful. This quiet, SELF CHECK IN apartment is on the top floor of a renovated historic home and has amenities for families, business travelers, and students alike, including queen beds, air conditioning, WiFi, smart TV, washer and dryer, oven, dishwasher, and more! If you have never been to Jersey City, you are in for a treat. Safe neighborhood with restaurants, shops and parks within a few blocks.

The space
This apartment is both modern and cozy, with one private bedroom, a sleeping alcove and pull out queen size couch. The space is open, with hardwood floors, and high ceilings.

Bedroom 1- Master bedroom: Queen
Alcove: Queen
Additional bedding: Queen pull out sofa

The sun pours in to make for a cheery space and there are adjustable blackout shades in the bedroom and sleeping alcove for a good nights rest.

The kitchen has brand new appliances and there is an in-unit washer and dry
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is filled with restaurants, bars, and shops within a few blocks from the apartment.  3 blocks away is Hamilton Park, with lawns, playgrounds, tennis courts, restaurants, coffee shops, ice cream, gym, and occasional farmers market.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Hello,

A little about me.  I love city, beach life and mountains equally and I've traveled all over the world. 

I am more of a backpack traveler, mostly because I like to travel light and change directions when the mood strikes me. I tend to take athletic vacations over lay on the beach vacations.

I'm a former marathoner and still like to go mountain climbing.

Thanks for checking out my home. I do hope you stay at my place.

Jane

name: Gorgeous Duplex with parking by JSQ
description:
**Stay with peace of mind - all of our rentals are cleaned before and after each stay by a professional cleaning agency trained in proper disinfection techniques. All our rentals also feature digital locks for easy self check-in**

20 minutes by car to NYC. Situated in a quiet, residential neighborhood, this is the perfect place for your family or group to relax after a long day exploring NYC or Jersey City. There is even a Foosball table for your enjoyment and there's parking for 1 car for your convenience.

- 24/7 guest support via message, email, or phone
- Professionally cleaned
- Self check-in

To abide by all legal requirements and HOA rules, you WILL be asked to provide a copy of your official government-issued photo ID, confirm your contact information, pass through our verification portal and, in some instances, complete a criminal background check. Failure to provide these documents will result in a cancellation and denied entry.
neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.
host_location: Plano, Texas, United States
host_about: Hello! I am a customer experience specialist at CozySuites and JC is the founder and head of guest experience at CozySuites. We are a tech-enabled hospitality company that's elevating the way people travel. We offer stylish, home-like accommodations for all types of travel. Every CozySuite features modern decor and amenities that make guests feel right at home. We offer accommodations in many cities around the U.S. Have questions? Our guest services team is available 24/7 to help.

name: $100 night w parking. Weekly/Monthly stays welcome
description:
Spacious apartment perfect for your stay! The offered space is great for long or short stays, with all the amenities and comforts of home. With large, clean bedrooms with great natural lighting but yet private and comfortable, a spacious eat-in kitchen, you will feel at home and comfortable during your stay! We are within walking distance of the light rail station, which can link you to downtown, nearby Hoboken and NYC! There are also 2 beautiful parks with a view just blocks from your stay.

The space
Guests are welcomed to all the amenities and comforts of the apartment, including stocked coffee, fresh towels, soaps, shampoos, parking space and more. Host on-premises in another unit.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood has numerous coffee shops, pizza parlors, and great restaurants to visit during your stay, as well as beautiful parks with a view of NYC. The shopping strip is within blocks of your stay.  With a quick ride on the light rail or taxi, visit historical Liberty State Park, Ellis Island, local season farmers markets, and more!
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Our home is blessed with 5 generations.
Our home was built in the early 1900's and purchased in 1957 by my grandfather for $7,000. Today, our family still lives here with so many great memories.
It's a 2 family house and we've established a very warm and wonderful experience welcoming outstanding guests to enjoy our first floor apartment with a sense of heritage and pride.
Most Sincerely,
Patricia and family

name: Lincoln Park 4-bedroom 2-bathroom loft apartment
description:
Best Value for visiting NYC! Short Uber ride (around $7) or 25 minutes walking(1.3miles/2kms) to Journal Square Path Station, which will bring you to Manhattan in 15 minutes! 4-bedroom 2-bathroom loft apartment which sleeps 7 people comfortably with a kitchenette. Professionally cleaned after each stay. Apartment is directly facing 270-acre Lincoln Park. Easy access to highway. Plenty of street parking (as long as you don't arrive too late in the evening).

The space
The apartment is located on the third floor at the back of the building.

The apartment has 4 bedrooms fully furnished. One master bedroom has a queen size bed with a full master bathroom. The other three bedrooms each has a full size bed. Each bedroom features 12 inch memory foam mattress and premium bedding. The living room has a futon with additional bedding. The second full bathroom is by the living room.

description:
Must be Covid-19 Vaccinated and show Vaccine Card. It is for the safety for both the host as well as guests.

Bask in the island vibes of this bikini bottom oasis. Located in a 19th century pre war building this walk up will meet all your expectations.

The space
You'll have access to an array of diverse eats right outside your doorstep or Seamless and Door Dash deliver a wide range of culinary options.

Guest access
Guest will enjoy usage of a mini fridge, located within their suite.

We also provide an air circulator for cooling comfort at your request.

Other things to note
Upon request guest can inquire about the various must see destinations NYC/NJ has to offer during there trip. We also have a Citibike kiosk across the street from our building.

name: Private Studio for your NYC getaway!
description:
This mid-subterranean studio in a Multi-family home is perfect if you're visiting NYC. Located in Jersey City Heights - close to JC downtown, Newport Center, & Grove street. To get to NYC:
* Half block walk to buses that take you to Port Authority NYC OR Journal Square where you'll find NJ Path trains to 33rd st or Wall St, NYC
* 20 minute walk to the 9th st./Congress light rail (Hoboken)

Only street parking available. Full size bed + sofa bed. Kitchenette (no stove). Restaurants 2 blocks away

The space
Microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker in studio. Full private bathroom with private entrance. 1 full size bed AND 1 sofa bed. Max of 2 people
neighborhood_overview: JC Heights offers a city vibe with Latino spice.  Cute coffee places and restaurants nearby offering a mix of American and Latino cuisine.  Take an uber to downtown JC, Newport area, or Grove and you'll get even more choices of tasty restaurants and cool locations to explore.  Neighborhood park in walking distance, quick transportation options, laundromat on the corner, and bodegas galore.

name: Spacious&Sunny 1Bdrm Apt, 1 block to GroveSt. Path
description:
Spacious & sunny, 1 bedroom apartment located just 1 block from Grove St. Station. Catch 5 min NJ Path train to Downtown Manhattan. Very clean, fully equipped with tons of charm. Perfectly located in the heart of downtown Jersey City! Tons of restaurants, bars, and shops everywhere. Laundromat directly across the street! Perfect location for enjoying NYC and NJ. Tons of sunlight and windows.

The space
Comfortably sleeps two couples or 4 people who don't mind sharing a beds. Full kitchen, wifi, and tons of records for your listening pleasure. There's also a charming little nook which can double as luggage storage or a small office space.
neighborhood_overview: Literally, located right in the heart of booming, downtown Jersey City! Quickly becoming the new Brooklyn.  There are too many restaurants, bars, shops, markets, etc. to name.  Literally everything you might need during your stay is within a 3 block radius.  Best of all, you are 1 block away from the Grove St. Path Station that is a 5 min train ride into downtown Manhattan.  Laundry is directly across the street.

The apartment has many warm homey touches and is the perfect place to relax and/or work from home. This is truly and urban oasis close to NYC.

The space
Our home is located conveniently in the middle of the Jersey City Heights neighborhood . The space is on the ground floor of a brownstone building . You will occupy your own private space , enjoy a quaint backyard garden. Close to shopping, cafes and parks . It is in a lively neighborhood and it easily walkable. Buses to the Port Authority NYC /time square run every hour and are a 5 minute walk from the house.

Guest access
First floor of 3 floor home. Backyard garden i

host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I am young, 'trendy' (try to be) professional living in New York.  I moved to NY one year ago from London, although I'm originally from Australia. 

My style of Airbnb-hosting is to provide an extremely high standard - the best service and 'space' that I can, so that my guests enjoy themselves to the fullest.  Over the last few years I have had the pleasure of staying in many Airbnb places all around the world; and I have had wonderful experiences.  Now I want to return the favor, I want you to feel like you are in a 5 Star Hotel.   

Briefly about my career... Two years ago I moved out of the 'Start-up field' to start my own business in Real Estate, and haven't looked back since.  

My motto in life is cliche but true: You can get anything you want in your life as long as you put your heart and mind into it, whilst at the same time having a strong sense of integrity.
